loans.name: Mrs. Chroek Phean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroek P. is the village bank president of the village bank which consists of sixteen people who live in Taing Pon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chroek P. sells coal in the local village. Aside from this, she breeds cows and is raising two. Her husband, Mr. Sem Tuen, owns a small kiln where he can make coal for his wife to sell. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Chroek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood for her husband to make coal. Mrs. Chroek P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the youngest one is only three years old. There are three men who are shown in the picture, instead of their wives. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to repay. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband to make coal for her to sell

loans.name: Ewuraba

texts.en: Ewuraba E. sells fish, maize, and other food items at Nyame Tsease in Elmina. Ewuraba has received no formal education. She is a widow and has 5 children. Ewuraba has been selling these food items since 1995. She is responsible for the feeding the family, utility bills, and the children's school fees. She plans to use the loan to purchase more items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to gradually build a house for the children.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Haticha

texts.ru: Аллоерова Хатича проживает в районе Вахш . Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговое место на центральном рынке района , где торгует одеждой. Муж в России на заработках. Поэтому вся ответственность за семью лежит на ней. Ей приходится много работать для того ,  чтобы обеспечить детей. Планирует получить кредит , чтобы завезти осенне – зимнюю одежду . Это позволить заработать в период димесезонноц торговли.
texts.en:
Haticha A. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. For the last 15 years Haticha has been making a living selling clothes at the central market. Her husband is working in Russia so the responsibility for taking care of her family lies on Haticha's shoulders. She has to work a lot to support her four children. Haticha is applying for this loan in order to buy fall-winter clothes for the market stall, in order to be prepared for the coming season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fred Ato

texts.en: Since 1994, Fred Ato M. has been selling ice blocks and operating a pepper-milling machine in Elmina. Fred Ato has received tertiary education. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees, providing food for the family, and paying the utility bills. He plans to use the loan to buy spare parts for his milling machine. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest and expand the business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for pepper-milling machine

loans.name: Bahrinisso

texts.ru: Раджабова Бахриниссо живет в районе Кободиен. Занимается торговлей. Торгует паласами и коврами. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Она разведена и имеет троих детей. Так что ее бизнес единственный источник ее семьи. Развитие бизнеса поможет ей улучшить условия в деле и соответственно получать дополнительный доход для семьи.
texts.en:
Bahrinisso R. lives in the Kobodien region of Tajikistan. She is divorced and has three children. Bahrinisso sells rugs and kilims for a living and is applying for this credit to expand her inventory. As her business is the sole source of income for her family, investing into her business will help her expand it and consequently allow for additional income for her family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem N. lives in Phum Thei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Phan Da, emigrated to work in Korea as a laborer. Mrs. Nhem N. is 42 years old and the mother of a child who is attending school. Nowadays, she is building a new house for her household; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to complete it so Mrs. Nhem N. decided to ask for a loan to pay for the building costs.

loans.use: To pay the building costs of a new house

loans.name: Malika.

texts.ru: Ахмедова Малика жительница города Шахритуз. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом уже 2 года. Торгует нижним бельем  и другими принадлежностями . Планирует получить кредит для того ,чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.Этьо поможет ей увеличить доход семьи
texts.en:
Malkia A. lives in the city of Shahrituz. She is married and has three children. For the last 2 years she has been managing a underwear and lingerie retail business. Malkia is planing to use this loan to expand her inventory and wants to pay it back in the next 12 months. This loan will help her get more income from the business and so provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Chet V. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions.  She is a teacher in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, and she can make $30 per month which is very little to support her family. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pok Samorn, is a government officer in the Tax Department in the provincial town. Mrs. Chet V.'s neighbor wants to sell a piece of land at a reasonable price, so Mrs. Chet V. wants to buy it to then resell later at a better price. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings, and achieve this goal. Mrs. Chet V. is 54 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Chet V. had obtained a loan to buy pigs for breeding. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and then resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Riziki Kwa Mungu Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 and married with 3 children between 6 and 2 years old. She has been a charcoal and food seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanaisha now seeks a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanajuma, who has a business dealing with food and kerosine sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Назарова Мукаддас бизнесмен со стажем. Уже 8 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке района. Оттуда продает нижнее белье для женщин и мужчин. Кроме этого в ассортименте имеется другие виды товара. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент , пополнив его осенне-зимнем товаром. Поагсить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Ей 33 года и она имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Mukadas N. is an experienced businesswoman. She has been working in retail for the last 8 years. Mukadas manages a stall at the regional market and sells underwear for men and women along with other types of goods. She wants to take out this loan in order to expand her inventory by purchasing additional fall/winter seasonal goods. She is planing to pay back the loan in the next 12 months. She is 33 years old and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: This is the second time that Mrs. Kim C. V. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She lives in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Cheap Sarin, helps her with the business. Mrs. Kim C. V. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to study. Previously, Mrs. Kim C. V. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has succeeded in paying the loan off.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Leng C. N. has taken out a loan to improve her business activity. She sells fruit in the local market, which is located in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is doing well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demands. Her husband, Mr. Vath Sovvan, assists her with her business. Mrs. Leng C. N. is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending school. Previously, Mrs. Leng C. N. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit

loans.name: Hamrohon

texts.ru: Назаров Хамрохон  проживает а районе Вахш. Занимается услугой такси. Необходимо получить кредит для того , чтобы отремонтировать машину. Автомобиль это единственный источник дохода его семьи. Поэтому ремонт машины сможет обеспечить его бесперебойной работой.Хамрохон женат и у него четверо детей. Живут они дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Hamrohon N. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. He is a taxi driver and wants to take out this loan in order to repair his car. Hamrohon's taxi business is the sole source of income for his family and repairing his car will assure that he can continue working without interruptions. Hamrohon is married and has four children. He has a great family who are very close to each other.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi cab repair

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Chan N. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food in Trapaing Chi Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sun Saroeurn, sells vegetables in the local market. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables in order to meet the needs of consumers. Mrs. Chan N. is 49 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Mrs. Chan N. had previously obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Maguno's Mpaji Ni Mungu Group

texts.en:
Maguno is 48 and divorced with 5 children between 29 and 3 years old. She has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Magunao now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Neema, who has a business dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Namoz.

texts.ru: Азимов Намоз житель района Вахш. Женат и имеет троих детей. Работает таксистом . Кроме этого имеет шестилетний стаж работы в животноводстве.  Поэтому планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить бычка. Жена нигде не работает поэтому она сможет обеспечить полноценный уход за бычком. После откормки он сможет реализовать его по более выгодной цене.Погашать кредит паланирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Namoz Azimov is a resident of the Bakhsh region. Married and the father of three children, he drives a taxi. In addition he has six years of work experience in animal husbandry, therefore he is planning to take out a loan to buy a bull. As his wife does not work, so she will be able to take excellent care of the bull. After fattening it, Namoz will be able to sell it for a profit. He plans to pay off the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Kruoch

texts.en: This is the second time that Mrs. Kruoch D. has taken out a loan in order to improve her business. She is a rice middleman in Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Preap Sophal, is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. They have three children who are all attending school. Even though Mrs. Kruoch D. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their household. Thus, Mrs. Kruoch D. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings and buy a rice mill in order to start a new business. Previously, Mrs. Kruoch D. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport the rice that she buys from the villagers, and she has fully repaid it.

loans.use: To buy a rice mill

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Since 2006, Ebenezer A. sells building materials, such as paint, painting brushes, and other items, at Nyanta in Elmina. Ebenezer received a junior high education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees, providing food for the family, and paying the utility bills. He plans to use the loan to buy more building materials to sell. He hopes to use the increased profits to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Samira's Tunasubra Group

texts.en:
Samira is 27 years and married with 2 children, aged 4 and 2. She has been a food seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Samira is now looking for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Siti, who has a business dealing with cake and bread sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: This is the fifth time of Mrs. Mork C. L. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She lives in Trapaing Pouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she sells rice and farms. Her husband, Mr. Muth Art is a fisherman and pig breeder. His fishing business is facing a small problem, because his boat is too old. So, Mrs. Mork C. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Mork C. L. is 34 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Mrs. Mork C. L. had previously obtained a loan to buy a pump for watering her plantation, which she fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Ярматова Малика проживает в районе Хуросон. В центре района имеет диллерский центр , где реализует пластиковые карты сотовых компаний. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить карточки. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет . Дело приносит доход позволяющий прокормить семью. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка.Увеличение товарооборота позволит ей обеспечить рынки района данным видом товара. Погашать  кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Malika Y. lives in the Khuroson region. She owns a dealership center at the center of the region where she sells plastic cards from cellular companies. Malika plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a supply of cards for sale. She has been in this business for 5 years. The business brings her an income that allows her to feed her family. Malika is married and has one child. Increasing her inventory will allow her to provide regional markets with phone cards. She plans to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of phone cards

loans.name: Ey

texts.en: Mrs. Ey S. O. is a farmer in Smek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Nop Lon, is a retired soldier who can only make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Ey S. O. gets small revenue from her plantation, but it cannot support her family, so she would like to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate in order to expand her rice revenue. Mrs. Ey S. O. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom works in a rice mill and makes a small income to support the household. The youngest one attends school. Previously, Mrs. Ey S. O. had obtained a loan from AMK for buying rice to resell later at a better price. She has fully paid it back. In 2003, her husband had an accident and Mrs. Ey S. O. spent $500 to cure him. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is married with 5 children between 25 and 5 years old. She has been a tailor since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Najat now requests a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em C. is a villager in Ti Prumpei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fashionable clothes to re-sell.

Her husband, Mr. Phoem Thorn, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Em C. is 35 years old and the mother of four children one of whom helps her in selling clothes while the remaining three are attending school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah E. has sold firewood at Elmina since 1993. Hannah has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. She is responsible for feeding the family, paying utility bills, and paying the children's school fees. She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood to sell. She hopes to use the increased profits to reinvest and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Usuf

texts.ru: Кодиркулов Юсуф житель района Хуросон. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Это дело единственный источник его семьи. Планирует получить кредит для тього , чтобы купить породистую корову для разведения породистого  потомства. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yusuf K. is a resident of the Khuroson region. He lives with his family, his wife and four children. He works in animal husbandry, which is his family’s sole source of income. He plans to take out a loan to buy a purebred cow for breeding purposes. He will be able to repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 15 and 4 years old. She has been a potato seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Arafa is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. is married and has one child. She received schooling through senior high. At Elmina, Hannah sells bread that she bakes herself. She started baking bread in 2004. Her husband is a fisherman.

Hannah uses her income to pay for food to feed the family, utility bills and her child's school fees. Hannah plans to use the loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making the bread she sells. With the increased profit from her expanded business, Hannah plans to help her husband build the family house.

loans.use: Purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making bread to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Исмоилова Фируза – бизнесмен. Работает и проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается торговлей книг. Привозит книги из города Душанбе и продает их у себя на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти новый ассортимент книг. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года и ее бизнес позволяет ей обеспечивать ее семью . Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живут они дружно , но только единственным источником дохода семьи является ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Firuza I. is a business woman who trades in books and works and lives in the Khuroson region. She brings in books from Dushanbe to sell at her place in the market. She plans to take out a loan to increase her inventory and supply a broader selection of books. She will be able to repay the loan over the course of twelve months. Firuza has been in this sort of trade for three years and her business permits her to support her family, which includes her husband and three children. They live amicably, but the only source of income for her family is her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Un A. is asking for a loan to improve her business. She and her husband, Mr. Loch Phon, are fishermen in Samraong Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province. In their business, they now face a small problem because they do not have enough fishing equipment to catch more fish so Mrs. Un A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for their purpose.

Mrs. Un A. is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom uses electricity to charge batteries to make income while another one is employed in a garment factory. The third one helps the parents' business while the youngest one is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Un A. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a machine battery charger for her first child's business. She has fully paid that loan back.

loans.use: to buy more fishnets in order to catch more fish

loans.name: Fat-Hia

texts.en:
Fat-hia is 23 years old and single. Since 2005, she has been earning income running her own shop. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$35 from the sales.

Fat-hia currently needs a loan to buy additional commodities for sale at her store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional commodities for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Sok N. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She owns a small grocery in the local market which located in Phlov Veay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so Mrs. Sok N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

Her husband, Mr. Tep Sakhean, owns a rice mill which he can make income from. Mrs. Sok N. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Sok N. obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house for her household. She has succeeded in paying that loan back.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Thi Van's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Vân năm nay 35 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0001. Vay 5.152.000 đồng. Chị Vân vay vốn cùng chồng đi buôn nứa về để đan giường và làm tráng bánh đa. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Ngoài ra, chị còn làm công tác xã hội như làm chi hội phó phụ nữ thôn. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000đồng/ ngày.
Trong nhóm chị gồm:
<li> Nguyễn Thị Phương: 40 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0002. Vay 4.704.000đồng. Chị Phương vay vốn để làm nghề mỳ và chăn nuôi.
<li> Tô Thị Hiệp: 38 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0003. Vay : 4.704.000 đồng. Chị Hiệp vay vốn để chăn nuôi và làm nghề tráng mỳ bán.
<li> Nguyễn Thị Thanh: 61 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0004. Vay : 3.808.000 đồng. Cô Thanh vay vốn để chăn nuôi.
<li> C. Thị Bé: 43 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0006. Vay: 3.808.000 đồng. Cô Bé vay vốn về để chăn nuôi.
<li> Nguyễn Thị Thu: 49 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0005. Vay: 4.704.000 đồng. Cô Thu vay vốn về để đi chợ buôn bán hoa quả.
<li> C. Thị Ninh: 51 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0007. Vay: 4.256.000 đồng. Cô Ninh vay vốn về để đi chợ buôn bán quần áo.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Vân (13.03.0001), 35 years old, borrowing 5.152.000đ. With her husband, she trades bamboo for bed-knitting and produces dry pancakes. She has two school age children. Besides, she also performs social work T. help the village's women. The family's income is about 200.000đ per day. Her group includes:
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Phương (13.03.0002), 40 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. make noodles and raise animals.
  • Ms. Tô Thị Hiệp (13.03.0003), 38 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. make noodles and raise animals.
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thanh (13.03.0004), 61 years old, borrowing 3.808.000đ in order T. farm animals.
  • Ms. C. Thị Bé (13.03.0006), 43 years old, borrowing 3.808.000đ in order T. farm animals.
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thu (13.03.0005), 49 years old, borrowing 4.704.000đ in order T. buy and sell fruit at the market.
  • Ms. C. Thị Ninh (13.03.0007), 51 years old, borrowing 4.256.000đ in order T. buy and sell clothing at the market.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading and animal farming

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy Q. sells eggplant, tomatoes, onions, yams, and other food items at the Elmina new market since 1989. Lucy received a senior high education. She is divorced and has 2 children. She is responsible for providing food for the family, paying utility bills, and paying the children's school fees.

She plans to use the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell. She hopes to use the increased profits to help her husband pay for the children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Gurez

texts.ru: Гадоев Гурез житель района Вахш . Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается сельским хозяйством. Выращивает семечки. Полученный урожай продает оптом. В данный момент урожай поспел и для сбора и реализации необходима транспортировка. Для этого и планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему своевременно реализовать товар и подготовить землю к новому посеву.
texts.en:
Gurez G. is a resident of the Vakhsh region. 46-years-old, he is married and has four children. He teaches in a high school, and additionally engages in agriculture, growing sunflower seeds. The resulting crop is sold wholesale. His crop is now ripe and the 12-month loan he plans to take out would go towards harvesting and shipping it. This will help him to sell his goods on time and to prepare the ground for a new planting.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transporting his harvest

loans.name: Chrich

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrich C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Keo Um, 42, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. Three of their children are garment factory workers and other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Chrich has been selling fruit and Cambodian cake at a market in Phnom Penh for a few years. Before starting this business she used to be a silk weaver. Mr. Keo has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill he learned from a villager. He sells his finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Currently, Chich needs to expand her fruit-selling business but lacks the money.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fruits for resale and to buy silk materials for her husband's weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing fruit to sell and buying silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 34 years old, married, and has four children, 2 to 15 years old. She has been working as a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, Riziki works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$70 from the sales.

Riziki now needs a loan to buy additional clothes for sale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Asha's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is married and has 7 children, all between 20 and 30 years old. Since year 2000, Asha has been earning income as a bites seller. She works every day and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

Currently, Asha needs a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with bread and juice sales.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., 48, and her husband, Mr. Sarun Sanh, 49, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 1985 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Their first daughter is a garment factory worker and the second daughter sell fruits in front of a factory. Their two sons study in the local school.

Mrs. Sokhom has been selling meals for five years. She cooks by herself for sale in front of a garment factory about one kilometer from her home. Her husband has been a wooden house constructor for fifteen years. The couple is in the process of repairing their house and lacks the money to finish part of the house. Therefore, Sokhom is requesting a loan of US1000 to purchase materials for making a wall for her house.

loans.use: To make a wall for her house.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru: Халимов Наджмиддин проживает в районе Вахш. Работает в средней школе №9 района Вахш. Кроме того , для того , чтобы обеспечивать свою семью занимается животноводством. Откармливает бычков на продажу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса 15 лет. Бизнес приносит доход , который позволяет ему создавать условия для семьи. В связи с жарким летом  возникли проблемы с кормом. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и закупить сено. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Najmiddin H. lives in the Vakhsh region, and works at Vakhsh regional secondary school number nine. In addition, in order to support his family, he engages in animal husbandry, fattening cattle for sale. He has been in this business for fifteen years, earning a profit that permits him to improve his family’s standard of living. Due to the hot summer there were problems with the feed, and therefore he has decided to take out a loan to purchase hay. He plans to repay the loan over the course of twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn S. (pictured with her daughter), 43, and her husband, Mr. Ra Dul, 44, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school.

Mrs. Orn has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker.

Orn is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a widow and has 3 children. She attended school through junior high. Since 1999, Mercy has been selling shoes, plastic bowls, and other items at Elmina. Mercy uses her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees, feed the family, and pay the utility bills.

Mercy plans to use the loan to purchase more items to sell. With the increased profit, Mercy plans help her husband meet their children's educational needs.

loans.use: Mercy will use the loan to add to her capital to increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sineat E. , 46, and her husband, Mr. Song Soy, 50, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school.

Mrs. Sineat has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a chef. He cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in his village and near-by villages.

Sineat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru: Гуломов Алимурод житель района Хуросон. Женат и имеет семерых детей. Для того чтобы прокормить такую большую семью занимается  бизнесом в сфере животноводства.Покупает бычков для откормки , а затем перепродает на базаре. Узнав, про  возможность получить кредит решил обратиться к нам за помощью. Использовать кредит планирует для покупки бычка. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и помочь развивать животноводческий сектор. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alimurod G. lives in the Khuroson district. He is married and has seven children. In order to support such a big family, he runs a business raising animals. He buys bull calves to raise to market weight , then resells them at the market. Having found out about the availability of loans, he decided to come to us for assistance. He plans to use a loan to buy a bull calf. This will help him increase sales turnover and help develop the animal husbandry sector. The loan will be paid back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bull Calf Purchase

loans.name: Ramla's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Ramla is 32 years old, married, and has three children, all between 3 and 8 years old. Since 2007, Ramla has been earning income as a bites seller. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$80 from the sales.

Ramla is now asking for a loan to improve her business by expanding the stock of goods. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, Mwanahawa and Somoe, who have businesses dealing with cassava an clothing sales.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun L., 29, and her husband, Mr. Pak Bo, 32, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two children; one son and one daughter. All of them are in the local school.

Mrs. Sokun has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She is also teaching her husband to become a silk weaver. Besides weaving, he is also a construction worker. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sokun is requesting a loan of 400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Agyei

texts.en: Agyei H. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Agyei sells wood to carpenters and building contractors at Nyanta in Elmina, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a fishmonger. Agyei uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, food and utility bills. Agyei will use the loan to purchase more wood to meet the increasing demand of his costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Agyei plans to save to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to meet the increasing demand of his costumers.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Джамиева Майсара проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Разведена и имеет троих детей. Занимается животноводством. Закупает молодых бычков , а после откормки продает.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года, после того , как она развелась с мужем.Планирует купить породистого бычка для чего и планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей увеличить прибыльность дела и равивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Maisara J. lives in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. She is divorced and has three children. She raises animals; young bull calves are purchased, raised to market weight, and sold. She has been in this business for the two years since her divorce. She decided to buy a purebred bull calf, which she will do by taking out a 12 month loan. This will help develop the business and increase its profitability.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovan R., 35, and her husband, Mr. Chheang Saum, 61, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have no children.

Mrs. Sovan and her husband have been selling porridge and fried bananas since 1998. The couple need to expand their business by add more types of food such as Chinese noodle and coffee. They need to buy chairs and tables and build a new shelter to serve their customers. Therefore, Sovan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials for selling noodles and to build a new shelter for her business.

loans.use: To build a shelter and purchase materials for selling Chinese noodle.

loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Mrs. Rann R. (pictured with her husband and jars to ripen custard apples), 49, and her husband, Mr. Samet Dy, 50, live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have five children; two sons and three daughters. One of their daughters, a security guard, is married and lives in the family home. Two children have full-time employment and the other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Rann has been selling custard apples since 2003. She buys them from farmers in her village and nearby villages to ripen to sell at Ta Khmao market, while Mr. Samet has been growing vegetables since 1979. Rann's son-in-law is unemployed and he needs to buy a Remoque motor-taxi but lacks the money. (Remoque is a motorbike with a trailer on the back).

Therefore, Rann is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a Remoque taxi for her son-in-law to drive.

loans.use: To purchase a Remoque taxi for her son-in-law to drive.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Абдиев Шавкат проживает вместе со своей семьей в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 39 лет и 15 из них он занимается торговлей мяса. Покупает бычков и реализует в розницу на центральном рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет снабжать рынок свежим мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abidev Shavkat lives with his family in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. He is married and has four children. He is 39 years old, and has been a meat seller for 15 of those years. He buys bull calves and sells retail at the central market. He decided to obtain a loan to increase sales. This will help supply fresh meat for the market. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Afefa

texts.fr: Afefa S. est revendeuse de pagnes et des bijoux depuis 7 ans à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 32 ans, Afefa est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle souhaite par ce crédits acheter des pagnes et des bijoux pour la revente. Elle désire aussi faire des livraisons en gros. Afefa est une fidèle cliente de FECECAV car elle est à son troisième crédit et les remboursements sont toujours réguliers
texts.en:
Afefa S. has been a seller of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and jewelery for the last seven (7) years, in the small village of Adeta which is located 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Afefa is married and is the mother of three (3) children. With this loan she would like to buy decorative cloth and jewelery for resale. She would also like to make wholesale transactions. Afefa has been a loyal customer of FECECAV. This is her third loan and her loan payments have always been on schedule.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and jewelery for resale

loans.name: Salama's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Salama is 32 years old, married, and has a child, age 7. Since last year, Salama has been earning income selling clothes. Every day, she works from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$60 from the sales.

Salama is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and thereby improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with food and bites sales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sokchoeun Kan, 31, who live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have one son.

Mrs. Sim has been a silk weaver for seven years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a wooden house constructor for ten years.

Now Sim is requesting a loan of 200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Maiyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiyas K., 42, and her husband, Mr. Ly K., 43, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives in the family home and the other three children study in the local school.

Mrs. Maiyas and her husband have been raising ducks for ten years. They sell duck eggs to the middleman in the village. Beside this business, the couple has been fishing since they were young. Ly fishes in the Mekong River and his wife sells the fish in the village.

Maiyas is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase feed and ducks for raising and to buy fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To raise ducks and purchase fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi K. est âgé de 47 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants. Il tient un bétail à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  Il souhaite, par ce crédit, acheter des cabris, des moutons, et des porcs afin d’augmenter la capacité de son troupeau. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille
texts.en:
Kossi K., 47, is married and the father of 6 children. He raises livestock in Adeta, a village situated about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he wishes to buy kids, sheep, and pigs to extend his flocks. He is counting on this chance to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing kids, sheep, and pigs

loans.name: Hasina's Tusifarikiane Group

texts.en:
Hasina is 50 years old, married, and has nine children, all between 7 and 28 years old. Since 2005, Hasina has been earning income selling charcoal and firewood. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$70 from the sales.

Hasina currently needs a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for sale in order to improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with dress-making and general sales.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood for sale

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koeun C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Khorn Khom, 54, who live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have three sons. All of them study in the local school.

Mrs. Koeun has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been fishing since he was young. The couple also grow rice.

Koeun is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets for her husband and to buy a water pumping machine for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou H. est coiffeur depuis 3 ans à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 25 ans, Kokou est célibataire sans enfants. Il souhaite, par ce crédit acheter des tondeuses et aussi aménager son atelier. Ce faisant il gagnera la confiance de la clientèle et augmentera son chiffre d’affaire pour le remboursement de son crédit et aussi la survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou H. has worked as a barber for the last three years in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kokou is 25 years old, single, with no children. With this loan, he wants to buy some clippers and also make improvements to his salon. By doing this, he will gain his customers’ trust and increase his revenue so that he can repay his loan and help his family to survive.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers and make improvements to his salon.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Исматова Парвина жительница района Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Занимается бизнесом.Имеет магазаин , который арендует уже три года. Торгует продуктами питания. Парвина не замужем и живет в родительском доме , с родителями. Она одна  обеспечивает семью. Бизнес развивается  , и поэтому она планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Parvina I. lives in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. She is 29 years old and a businesswoman. For three years already she has been renting a store where she sells groceries. Parvina is not married and lives with her parents in their house. She alone supports the family. The business is growing, so she decided to obtain a loan and increase sales. The loan will be paid back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Maryam's Tusife Moyo Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 34 years old, married, and has three children, all between 3 and 10 years old. Since 2006, Maryam has been working as a food and clothing seller. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$90 from the sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Mwanajuma, who also has a clothing sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of food items and clothes for sale

loans.name: Tainghot

texts.en:
Mr. Tainghot H. (pictured with a cart for selling yellow cake), 28, and his wife, Mrs. Im It, 28, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children. One of them studies in the local school and the other one is still young and stays at home.

Mr. Tainghot and his wife have been selling yellow cakes for six years. He buys raw materials such as sugar, powder, cream, and eggs from the market to make yellow cakes, and sells them using his motor cart around his village and nearby villages. Tainghot is requesting a loan of US$200 to buy more raw materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business of selling yellow cakes.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa K. est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter des pagnes et des tissus de confection pour la revente.
texts.en:
Kossiwa K. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She would like to use this loan to buy pagnes and ready-made fabrics for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Halil

texts.ru: Халил житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается торговлей. Продает овощи и фрукты. Имеет торговую точку на продуктовом рынке района. Занимается этим бизнесом уже пятьб лет. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и получить дополнительную прибыль для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Halil lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi district. He is married and has six children. He has a business selling fruits and vegetables from his stall in the district's produce market. He has been in this business for five years. He decided to obtain a loan to increase his variety of goods. This will help attract new customers and bring additional income to his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Maria James's Dira Group

texts.en:
Maria J., age 49, is married with 4 children (ages 22, 18, 14, and 7). She has 2 businesses, catering and raising chickens. She started these businesses in 1980. She does catering twice a week. She works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $522.

Maria has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more equipment for the catering business. She hopes for a new loan to buy a cow for a milk business. She will share this loan with her subgroup (Dira) members, who sell meat, clothing, vegetables, and drinks and own some shops.

In the picture Maria is 3rd from the left.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milk sales

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyny Choun, 30, and her husband, Mr. Neang Kong, 38, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sreyny has been selling grocery items for three years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her home. Before starting this business she was a garment factory worker for ten years. Her husband has been a driver for a factory for sixteen years. Sreyny wants to add more grocery items to her store to serve her customers' needs.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase grocery items for resale at her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: M.Boubacar B. est un vendeur  de fruits ayant une experience de plus de cinq ans dans cette activite. Il parvient a encaisser des benefices journaliers de 3 000 F par jour . Ce qui lui permet d'entretenir difficilement une famille de deux enfants et une femme. Il sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille pour renforcer son stock et accroitre ses recettes
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar B. is a fruit merchant with more than 5 years' experience in this business. He manages to make a daily profit of 3,000 F per day. This meager income permits him to support his family of two children and a wife only with difficulty. He is asking for a loan of 150,000 F to bolster his stock and increase his earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster his working capital

loans.name: Gevifer Ngoda's Ngorogoro Group

texts.en:
Genifer Ngonda, age 55, is a widow with six children (ages, 36, 34, 32, 30, 27 and 25). She has a chicken business which she started in 1987. She opens from 7am to 5pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $435.

In the past Genifer has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy chicken feed. She hopes for a new loan to build a water reserve pit because of the shortage of water in her area. She also plans to buy more chicks. Genifer will share this loan with her subgroup, which belongs to Ngorongoro, who deal in selling fish, soap, clothes, rice and the tailoring business.

In the picture Genifer is the 1st from the left.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and build a water storage

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She processes them by smoking (a form of preserving the fish) and then later sends the fish to the market for sale at Elmina. Mary has received no formal education. She is a widow and has 7 dependents. Mary has been selling fish sale since 2002. She is responsible for paying for food, utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying "pagnes" and cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen for processing then makes them consumable and attractive to her costumers at Elmina. Grace has received a junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace has been selling fish since 1999. She is responsible for the feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the stock for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her husband in meeting the children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Mbaye Mbacke

texts.fr: M.G. est un couturier issu d'une d'une famille tres reputee dans ce domaine.il exploite un atelier de couture dote de trois machines a coudre et 2 employes. Il veut acquerir une quatrieme machine en prevision des fetes religieuses tres propices a son activite.
texts.en:
Mr. G. is a tailor from family renowned in that domain. He runs a workshop with three sewing machines and two employees. He wants to acquire a fourth machine in anticipation of the religious holidays that are very favorable to his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Victorine T. est âgé de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des bidons d’huiles, des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons, de sucres et des carrons de boîtes de conserves. Les fonds qui seront issus de ses ventes lui permettront de rembourser le crédit et aussi de prendre en charges certaines dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Victorine T. is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five. She runs a grocery shop in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She hopes to use this loan to increase the capacity of her business by buying drums of oil, sacks of rice, boxes of soap, some sugar, and boxes of canned food. The funds derived from her sales will enable her to repay the loan and also to cover certain household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of oil, sacks of rice, boxes of soap, some sugar, and boxes of canned food

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina Y. sells oil and other food items at Duakor which is a small town near Elmina. She also prepares gari (a popular food) for sale. Cassava is used for the preparation of gari. Angelina has received a senior high school education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Angelina has been selling gari, oil and other food items since 1985. She is responsible for helping in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more gari and different kinds of cooking oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for the gari production and different kinds of cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Siwa Hashim's Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Siwa H., age 47, is married with 6 children (ages 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, and 26). She has a general shop, which she started in 2001. She works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $435.

Siwa has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start a clothing sales business. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock and to open another shop with the same items. She will share this loan with her subgroup, Kipawa, members, who deal in tailoring, selling clothes, food, and hotels. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Siwa is 1st on the left.

loans.use: To increase her stock and to open another shop with the same items

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has six children, all between 3 and 24 years old. She works as a charcoal, firewood and food seller, on average, earning a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

Currently, Rehema is looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to the stock of goods in her store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional charcoal, firewood and food for sale

loans.name: Grace Esi

texts.en: Grace Esi T. sells groceries like biscuits, milk, milo and other things at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. Grace Esi has received senior high school education. She is a widow and has 3 children. Grace Esi has been selling groceries since 1991. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help improve the standard of living of the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has seven children, all between 1 and 24 years old. Rehema works as a charcoal seller, earning a monthly profit of about US$35.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Samira's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Samira is 32 years old, married, and has four children, 1, 7, 9 and 15 years old. Since 2005, Samira has been earning income selling juice and eggs. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., making a monthly profit of about US$30.

Samira now needs a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock of goods. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Warda.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food items for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is married and has 3 children. She has never received schooling. Comfort sells food items like beans, peppers and other things at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. She also prepares gari, which is a product of cassava, for sale, and she has been doing this since 1998. Comfort uses her income to help in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to support with her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and cassava, the major ingredient for the preparation of Gari

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 41 years old. She is married and earns income selling spices. Mariam works every day, making a monthly profit of about US$35 from the sales.

Mariam is now asking for a loan to expand her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Moza

texts.en:
Moza is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 20, 18 and 16 years old. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Moza is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Mwaka's Tusisahau Kwetu Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 42 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 19 years old. She is a bucket producer. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Mwaka is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaisha.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 34 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 14, 12 and 7 years old. She has been a used clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Pili now requests a loan to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Mensah

texts.en: Mensah Y. is a single parent and has one child. She has never received schooling. Mensah sells food items like gari at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina, which she has done since 1972. Mensah uses her income to help her husband in the payment of her children's school fees, feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills. Mensah will use the loan to purchase cassava, coconuts and other food to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mensah plans to invest in a building project she has started for herself and child.

loans.use: Mensah will use the loan to purchase cassava, coconuts and other foods to sell

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 8 and 2 years old. She has been a charcoal, bedsheet, and food items seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Salma now requests a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. sells food items like gari, cassava, and plantains at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. Alice has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a teacher. Alice has been selling food items since 1999. She is responsible for helping in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to add to her capital to increase sales, which will as a result in her meeting the financial needs of the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is 22 years old and she is single. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Husna is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for the  expansion of her business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 26 years old and she is single. She has been running her own shop since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma N., 63 ans est mariée avec des enfants majeurs qui l’aident dans les charges familiales. Elle est membre  et présidente du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et du jus de citron. Diouma veut renforcer son activité. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Diouma N., 63, is married with grown children who help her to support the family. She has been a member and the president of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling palm oil and lemon juice. Diouma wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and re-selling palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina Omerović was born in 1974 and she is from Kalesija. She is married and has two children, one 11 and the other 14 years old. Her husband is employed and he helps her with paying for food and the other things.

This is Sabina's first loan with Women for Women International, in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900). Sabina will use this loan to buy poultry. She wants to work more with poultry and in that way she will make better conditions of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G., 49 ans, mariée, 5 enfants à sa charge dont deux sont à l’école  est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 7 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter  du poisson séché et du yett à Diogué et revendre à Ziguinchor. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’aider ses proches. Elle est aussi matronne.<b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatou G., 49, is married and responsible for 5 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for 7 years. She wants a loan to buy dried fish and conch in Diogué and re-sell them in Ziguinchor. Her income permits her to improve living conditions for her family and to help those near and dear to her. She is also a matron. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sell dried fish and conch

loans.name: Safia's Imani Group

texts.en:
Safia is 46 years old and she is divorced with 1 child aged 25 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and porridge seller since 1998. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Safia now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Mirzeta

texts.en: Mirzeta Islamović is 36 years old. She is married and has two high school children. Her husband is employed and he pays for everything his family needs. Mirzeta wants that she, also, should earn and contribute, so she decided she will take a loan from Women for Women International in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900). This loan she will use to buy poultry. Her wish is that her business goes well and she will bring in income before winter.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 19, 15, and 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and bites (chapati) seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.

Mkasi is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 48 ans, mariée, 6 enfants (qui vont tous à l’école) à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du sucre, du lait, du café, des clous de girofle, des petits pois, du niébé et de l’huile pour renforcer son activité de vente de petit déjeuner. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.<b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Mariama D., 48, is married with 6 children (who are all enrolled in school) for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Place de Gao for one and a half years. She wants a loan to buy sugar, milk, coffee, cloves, green peas, niébé (cow peas), and oil to bolster her little business of selling breakfasts. Her income permits her to help support the family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling breakfasts

loans.name: Tatu's Hatuyumbishwi Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 36 years old and she is married. She has been running her own shop since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Tatu is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanamvua.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding more commodites for her business

loans.name: Njuma

texts.en:
Njuma is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 17, 15, and 2 years old. She has been a porridge and juice seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Njuma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Afiwo

texts.en: Afiwo Y. is married and has 6 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Afiwo sells gari, oil and other food items and drinks at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina, which she has done since 1981. Her husband is a mason. Afiwo uses her income to pay for the feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Afiwo will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afiwo plans to support her children's schooling, too.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es comerciante, adquiere motores de movilidad en mal estado, los arregla para después re venderlos. Su otra ocupación es la de transportista publico inter provincia, viaja una l una vez a la semana. Tiene el deber de mantener a sus tres hijos y esposa, así como pagar el alquiler (vive en la Zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su capital de operaciones, lo que le permitirá vender mayor cantidad de motores

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para  acceder al préstamo
texts.en:
Teodoro is a merchant, who acquires engines in a poor state, repairs them, and later resells them. He also works in public transportation within the province; he travels once a week. He is responsible for taking care of his three children and wife, as well as paying the rent (he lives in the Rió Seco zone of the city of El Alto). The loan will be used to increase his capital for operations, which will allow him to sell more engines. This is his first loan with Impro. The assessment carried out qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his work

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa A., 36 ans, mariée, avec ses 3 sœurs qui sont à l’école à sa charge  est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter  des pièces de tissus qu’elle va revendre au marché Boucotte ou elle a deux cantines. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Awa A., 36, is married and has her three sisters who are enrolled in school to care for. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for two years. Her business consists in buying lengths of cloth which she re-sells in the Boucotte market where she has two little shops. The income from her business allows her to improve living conditions for her family. She is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cloth

loans.name: Dora Veronica

texts.es:
Dora es costurera,  confecciona abrigos para damas de mediana calidad y los vende en la ciudad de El Alto. Esa es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que ayuda a su madre y hermanas, también se ocupa de pagar el alquiler (él y su familia viven en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de la maquina Overloock de mediana calidad, lo que permitirá que mejore la calidad de sus productos.

Es su primer crédito en Impro pero nuestra evaluación indica que no tendrá ningún tipo de problema con las cuotas
texts.en:
Dora is a seamstress, making average quality ladies’ jackets. She sells the jackets in the city of El Alto. This work is Dora’s principal source of income, and with the help of her mother and sisters, Dora is able to pay the rent (Dora and her family live in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto). Dora needs a loan to buy an average quality Overoock sewing machine, which will help her improve the quality of her products. This is Dora’s first loan with Impro but our evaluation indicates that she won’t have any problem making the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Zawadi's Waaminifu Group

texts.en:
Zawadi is 50 years old. She is married with 8 children aged between 27 and 9 years old. She is a charcoal and spices seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zawadi is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Bimkubwa.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 20, 17, and 12 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood and bites (chapati) seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rehema is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding  to her current stock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D., 48 ans, mariée est mère de 5 enfants dont quatre à sa charge et une enseignante. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 7 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter  des produits alimentaires comme le fonio, des cuisses de poulet et des poulets entiers et revendre au niveau de sa cantine situé au marché Boucotte de Ziguinchor. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer au bien être familial.<b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatou D., 48, is married and the mother of 5 children of whom 4 are still in her care and one is a teacher. Fatou has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for 7 years. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs such as fonio (a specialty grain), chicken thighs, and whole chickens to re-sell in her little shop in the Boucotte market of Ziguinchor. Her income allows her to contribute to her family's well-being. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Servando Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique inició el negocio por que a su esposa le gustan las ventas además de tener un ingreso extra por que le acababan de dar casa de infonavit y como en la calle donde vivían había muchos niños decidieron poner el snack para así conocer mas gente.Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años vendiendo nachos, tostadas, chicharrones, frituras, dulces y bollos, y les va muy bien.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía.
texts.en:
Enrique started the business because his wife enjoyed sales as well as to have some extra income, because they had just been given an Infonavit house (housing subsidized by the mexican mortgage corporation). Since on the street where they live there are many children, they decided to setup a snack bar in order to get to know more people. About 5 years ago he began selling nachos, tostadas, pork cracklings, fried foods, sweets and buns and sales go very well.

He needs a loan of $375 which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his snack bar.

loans.name: Maryam's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Maryam R. is 27 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 12 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit about $25 from her sales.

Maryam R. is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes (vitenge & khanga--traditional Tanzanian clothing) for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maryam A..

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge &khanga) for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inició el negocio por que siempre le ha gustado la repostería y por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso para mejorar su calidad de vida ya que sus hijos estaban estudiando y no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos tanto de la casa como darles lo necesario para acudir a la escuela. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo solamente empanadas y pan de elote hoy en día vende tortillas de harina tamales por pedidos y en ocasiones hace platillos de comidas para fiestas infantiles y le va muy bien ya que tenia muchos clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir los ingredientes par la elaboración de empanadas y tamales como es harina, manteca, azúcar, gas, carne, hojas y desechables.
texts.en:
Maria started the business because she has always liked food preparation and because of the need to have another income to improve her quality of life since her children were studying and she did not have enough to cover all the many expenses of the house or to give them the necessary things for school. She began approximately 6 years ago selling only empanadas and cornbread. Now she sells flour tortilla tamales to order and from time to time she prepares foods for children's festivals. Sales go very well since she has many clients.
