She needs a loan of $750 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to supply the ingredients for making empanadas and tamales such as flour, lard, sugar, cooking gas, meat, corn husks and disposables.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making tamales and empanadas

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar inició el negocio por que desde muy chico le gustaba hacer guisos y por necesidad se fue a laborar a Estados Unidos donde consiguió trabajo en un restaurante y hay fue adquiriendo experiencia y con el tiempo se decidió a regresar a su pueblo por que su esposa iba a tener su primera hija y no quería estar lejos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 4 años aunque de experiencia tiene mas años y ahora en la localidad labora también un restaurante por lo que de hay se ha dado a conocer para la elaboración de los banquetes ahora por su cuenta.

El necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir los ingredientes para la elaboración de un banquete de boda.
texts.en:
Oscar started the business because since he was a young boy he liked to cook dishes. By necessity, he went to work in the United States, where he obtained work in a restaurant and there he acquired experience. In time he decided to return to his hometown because his wife was going to have their first daughter and he did not want to be far away. He began approximately 4 years ago, although he has more years of experience and now in his town he also works for a restaurant where he has become known for preparing banquets, by his account.

He needs a loan of $150 US, that will be repaid in 3 months, to supply the ingredients for making the foods for a wedding reception.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for preparing food for a wedding reception

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie T., 28 ans, mariée, avec 01 enfant à sa charge  est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile, du riz et des draps batik qu’elle va revendre au niveau de sa boutique contenant déjà d’autres produits. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à l’entretien de sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Marie T., age 28, is married and has one child in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Place de Gao for two years. She wants a loan to buy oil, rice, and batik sheets that she is going to resell at her shop, which already has other goods. She wants to strengthen her business. Her income enables her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell oil, rice, and batik bed sheets

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia empezó a laborar en una empresa, posteriormente con lo que tenia ahorrado y con las prestaciones recibidas, ella decidió emprender su propio negocio para ser empleada y patrón. Ella tenía en mente que al mantener bien surtida su tienda de abarrotes y trabajarla adecuadamente iba a darle muy buenas ganancias. Entonces emprendió su negocio, empezó vendiendo solo los productos indispensables para su comunidad y poco a poco ha ido haciendo crecer su negocio.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara a 6 meses para la compra de surtido de mercancía y remodelación del local, para tener mas clientes y ganancias, ella tiene toda la fe que con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Amalia started out by working at a company and saving money. With the money she saved and loans she received, she decided to start her own business in order to be both employee and boss. She had it in her mind that maintaining a grocery store well stocked with a variety of products and working hard would bring her a good income. So she started her business, began selling only products that were indispensable to her community and little by little her business began growing.

Now, in order to accommodate more clients and bring in more income, she needs a loan of $375US, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a variety of merchandise and to remodel her store. She has total faith that with your support she will do it.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloriela Idalia

texts.es:
Gloriela inicio este negocio para ayudar en los gastos económicos de su hogar. Empezó comprando poco a poco ropa en los tianguis de esta ciudad, a un precio más económico del modo que tuviera ganancias. Inicio el negocio en su domicilio, vendiéndole a sus vecinas, amistades y al publico en general, le ha dejado buenas ganancias gracias a ello a podido solventar gastos en su hogar. Ahora tiene el deseo de invertir en ropa nueva, calzado, bolsas para dama y pues tener de todo un poco al igual que desea comprar unas pacas de ropa a precio de mayoreo.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara a 6 meses para poder tener variedad de mercancía, ella confía que con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gloriela began this business in order to help with her home expenses. Gradually, she began buying clothing in the markets of this city, at a cheaper price so that she could make profit.

She began her business in her home, selling to her neighbors, friends and to the general public. It has brought her good income and she has been able to pay off her bills. Now, she would like to invest in new clothes, shoes, and bags for ladies, and therefore have a little of everything. At the same time, she wishes to buy clothing in bulk at wholesale prices.

Gloriela is requesting loan of US $300, which she will repay in six months, in order to have product variety. She trusts that, with your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa inicio este negocio por que una amiga la convenció de que era bueno, por que le deja buenos ingresos además de que puedes administrar tu tiempo para trabajar, atender el hogar, hijos y esposo. Entonces ella empezó ayudándole a ella, vendiendo los productos cosméticos, se cercioro de que si era buen negocio, y entonces decidió entrar ella directamente con las compañías para trabajar por su cuenta y al igual tener mas amigas o conocidas que le quieran ayudar.

Hoy en día esta solicitando de un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancía a precio de mayoreo, para así poder implementar sus ventas, tener más clientes, poder darles crédito y al igual tener buenas ganancias, ella confía en el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Rosa started this business because a friend convinced her that it would be good, because it brings her a good income and allows her to manager her time to work and to attend the home, her children and her husband. Then she began helping her friend, selling cosmetics, and found out that, yes, it was a good business. Then she decided to begin dealing directly with the companies to work on her own account and at the same time to have more friends or acquaintances that would like to help her.

Now she is requesting a loan of $475 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, for the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices, in order to be able to pursue her sales, to have more clients, to be able to give them credit and at the same time to have good profits. She trusts in the support of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo inició el negocio para obtener ingresos que le permitieran sacar a sus hijos adelante porque tenia 5 hijos a los cuales alimentar y el dinero no alcanzaba para la comida. Su principal motivación fue la situación precaria en que vivían y tuvo que sacar adelante a mis hijos ella sola. La situación era desgastante porque no había trabajo y por eso se decidió a vender por su cuenta y le dio resultados. Comenzó hace ya muchos años vendiendo en su propia casa de todo lo que pudiera, y poco a poco conforme sus hijos fueron creciendo empezó a salir a la calle a ofrecer la mercancía que tenia, incluso en ocasiones ellos también le ayudaban porque sabían que de allí tenían que sacar para la escuela y los gastos de la casa. En el 2003, consiguió un triciclo y de casa en casa se iba vendiendo y le ayudo mucho porque sus clientes se empezaron a incrementar y así podía colocar mas mercancía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo began her business in order to obtain an income that would allow her to improve her children’s lives, because she had 5 children to feed but not the money for their food. Her principal motivation was the precarious situation in which they lived; she had to improve her children’s lives by herself. The situation was difficult because she didn’t have work and because of this she decided to sell things in her own business, and she got results. She began selling many years ago now, selling in her own home as best she could. Little by little, as soon as her children were older, she began to go out to the street and offer the merchandise that she had, sometimes with the children also helping because they knew that they had to do it in order to be able to go to school and for the household expenses. In 2003, she acquired a tricycle and went selling from house to house. This helped quite a bit because her clients began to buy more and now she is able to invest in more merchandise. She needs a loan of US$150 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise and to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohamed Zakharia's Kwitange Group

texts.en:
Mohamed Z., age 31, is married with 3 children (ages 9, 7, and 4). He has a shop for telephones. He started this business 2 years ago. He works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $270.

Mohamed has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business. He hopes for a new business to increase his stock. Mohamed will share this loan with his subgroup (Kwitange) members, who sell food, fruits, and vegetables and have shops.

In the picture, Mohamed is second from the right in a brown t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more phones for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 1 hija de 19 años, su esposo es albañil, es por eso que ella inicio su negocio para apoyarlo con los gastos familiares ya que sus ingresos eran variables, comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos y poco a poco logro incrementar sus clientes obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses comprar mercancía y así tener variedad para la temporada otoño que esta por empezar. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has a 19-year-old daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. Since his income was not steady, she started her business to help out with family expenses. Two years ago she began selling clothing to her neighbors and little by little she was able to increase her customers and make a good profit. She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 month, to buy merchandise and to have variety for the fall season which is about to start. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une couturière encore célibataire qui travaille dans un atelier avec d'autres. Elle a plus de cinq ans d'expérience dans cet activité, elle sollicite ce crédit de 150 000 fcfa pour acheter une machine pour faire face à ses nombreuses commandes. Ce qui va lui permettre d'augmenter ses gains, aider ses parents, et de s'occuper de lui.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a dressmaker. She is single and works in a salon with other dressmakers. She has more than five years experience in dressmaking and she is asking for this 150,000 FCFA loan ($350) to buy a sewing machine to fulfill her many orders. This will allow her to increase her profit, help her parents and look after herself.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana inició su negocio, cuando vio una buena oportunidad ya que su casa esta ubicada en una avenida principal de la colonia, por lo que seria un buen punto de venta. Inicio hace 10 años con una tienda de abarrotes, pero se dio cuenta que la ropa le dejaba mas márgenes de ganancia, por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de esta.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquiriendo ropa nueva de temporada otoño que esta por empezar.
texts.en:
Juana started her business when she noticed a good opportunity, since her house is located on the residential zone’s main avenue, which would be an optimal sales location. She started out with a general store 10 years ago, but she later realized that clothing gave her greater profits, which is why she decided to sell this instead.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can purchase apparel for the imminent fall season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (fall fashions)

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva es casada y tiene 3 hijos, inició el negocio de venta de calzado por catalogo para ayudar en el gasto familiar a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, ella comenzó hace un año vendiendo entre sus familiares y como le dio buenos resultados poco a poco ha ido ofreciendo a mas gente teniendo así mas clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir inventario para la temporada otoño.
texts.en:
Minerva is married and has three children; she started the business of catalog shoe sales to help her husband, a construction worker, with the family expenses. She started a year ago selling to family members and seeing it gave her good results she offered them to others, increasing her client base. She needs a loan of US $250 that will be repaid in three months to purchase inventory for the fall season.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es:
Fabiola inició el negocio porque ella laboro en una zapatería, y cuando inicio su familia se dio cuenta que es una actividad que puede hacer sin descuidar a sus pequeños hijos por lo que hace tres años con una vitrina que compro empezó su negocio en su domicilio, donde sus vecinos le compran.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir las novedades de temporada otoño que esta por iniciar
texts.en:
Fabiola began her business because she worked in a shoe store, and when she started her family she realized that this is an activity she can do without worrying about her small children so 3 years ago she bought a display case and began her business in his home, where her neighbors buy from her. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 6 months to acquire season items for fall.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher K. is 30 years old. He is single and lives in a small village located in the Northern Bekaa Valley, near the town of Baalback. Maher is an active and optimistic young man who owns a small shop where one can find anything from mobile phones to music. Maher has requested a $1000 loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new products and to improve the overall layout and decoration of his shop. Maher has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To improve the layout of Maher's shop and purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer emprendedora que inicio su negocio hace cinco años cuando se vio con un hijo que mantener, fue entonces que encontró en el comercio una actividad que le permitiría obtener ganancias que le ayudaran a sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, ella vende ropa, calzado y por las noches vende hot-dogs y antojitos en un carrito.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Nelly is an enterprising woman who started her business five years ago in order to take care of her son. She found that her business allowed her to earn money that helped her provide for her son’s future. She sells clothing and footwear during the day. At night, she sells hot dogs and snacks from a cart.

She needs a $475 loan, which she would repay over 6 months, in order to buy the raw materials necessary to move forward with her business plans. With your support she will be able to realize her business goals.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Zaida Judith

texts.es:
Zaida inició su negocio cuando su madre le recomendó que consumiera una línea de productos naturistas debido a unos malestares que padecía y que la ayudaron, entonces ella decidió empezar a venderlos desde hace dos años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mercancía e incrementando sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Zaida started her business when her mother recommended to her that she take a line of natural products due to some bodily discomfort she was experiencing and they helped her. She then decided to start selling them two years ago. She needs a loan for US$475 which she will repay in six months to acquire merchandise and increase her inventories.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal K. is a 31-year-old single man who lives in a small village located in Lebanon's Northern Bekaa Valley, close to the town of Baalback. Talal owns a shop for repairing bicycles and motor bicycles. He is a very ambitious business owner and has decided to enlarge his repair operations in his town. Talal has requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to renovate his shop and purchase new repair tools.  This will be Talal's first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To renovate Talal's bicycle shop

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad D. is a 32-year-old man who lives in a small Lebanese village near Baalback in the Bekaa Valley. Jihad owns a small music shop and is constantly searching for new products to please his customers. He has asked Al Majmoua for a $1,200 loan in order to improve the layout and decoration of his shop, and to purchase a more diverse selection of music. Jihad has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years.

loans.use: To improve the decoration and layout of Jihad's music shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 21, 18 años. Inició el negocio por la situación de no encontrar empleo y tome la iniciativa de auto emplearse y así tener un sueldo para sostener a su familia y apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo por catalogo prendas para el hogar como sabanas, colchas etc y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes y ha ido incrementando sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder surtir los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a married mother of 3 grown-up children ages 23, 21, and 18. She started the business because she was unable to find a job, so she took the initiative and got into self-employment, thus allowing herself to earn income with which to support her family and to help her children with their education. Five years ago, she started selling bedding such as bed sheets, bedspreads, etc. Little by little, she has managed to increase both her clientele and her income.

She needs a loan of $250 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise so that she can fill all her pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena inició el negocio por que estudio en una escuela de belleza la colocación de uñas y cosméticos, y ante la necesidad de tener un empleo que le ayudara a obtener ingresos y ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo estaba trabajando fuera por lo tanto tenia que conseguir ingresos. Comenzó en su casa colocando uñas de acrílico y gel, y gracias a su buen servicio ha logrado hacerse de clientes que le ha dado bunas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6meses para la compra de una lámpara UV. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Macarena started the business because she studied in a beauty school how to apply nails and cosmetics, and due to the need to have a job that helped her have an income to help with the household expenses because her husband was working far away and she had to get money coming in. She started in her home applying acrylic nails and gel and thanks to her good service has succeeded in having clients that allow her to earn a good income. She needs a loan for US$250 which she will repay in six months to buy a UV lamp. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a UV lamp

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam R. lives in a small Lebanese village close to Baalback, in the valley of the Bekaa. Houssam owns a small cafe where he makes a wide array of sandwiches and platters for his loyal customers. Nearly anything his customers desire, Houssam can make. Though he is only 25, he has been an Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) client for the past 2 years, during which time he has been able to slowly improve his cafe's selection and presentation. Houssam has recently asked Al Majmoua for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase new equipment and paint his popular eatery.

loans.use: To purchase new appliances and paint his cafe

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith  tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Se dedica a la venta de diversos productos de decoración, lo que realiza en su domicilio  durante una parte del día, este negocio lo inició hace unos meses, desea consolidarlo, puesto que esta actividad es lo más le agrada, y a la vez brindar los mejores productos a sus clientes.Por el contrario, lo difícil, es ambientar su local para que sea más acogedor para las personas y decorar su propio local para hacerlo más llamativo.
Judith basa su esfuerzo en sus dos menores hijos quienes son su mayor adoración. 
Ahora iniciará una sociedad con su hermana, para mejorar el local y consolidarlo como el mejor de su ciudad, para ello, tendrá que invertir mayor cantidad de capital, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children. She sells various decoration products from home during part of the day. She started this business several months ago and would like to strengthen it because she loves her job and would like to offer better products to her clients. On the other hand, it is hard because she has to redecorate her shop to make it more attractive. Judith's efforts are inspired by her two youngest children whom she loves. She will now form a partnership with her sister in order to improve her shop and make it the best in her city. For this, she will have to invest more money, which is why she asks for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her business and redecorate her shop

loans.name: Sandra Araceli

texts.es:
Sandra inició el negocio por tener un ingreso y poder mantenerse ya que es soltera y vive con sus padres. Inicio hace tres años vendiendo lencería en su circulo mas cercano: familia y amigos y ahora esta mas establecida ya que tiene un local y ha logrado mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de lencería.
texts.en:
Sandra started the business to have an income and to be able to take care of herself because she is single and lives with her parents. She started three years ago selling lingerie in her closest circle of family and friends and now is more established because she has a shop and has achieved better earnings. She needs a loan for US$250 which she will repay in six months to buy lingerie.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Patricia Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Patricia inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidades económicas, ella aprendió este oficio de familia ya que su mama y tías venden fritangas y tamales, quienes le enseñaron el arte culinario, ella aprovecho sus conocimientos para ofrecer entre vecinos sus productos y poco a poco logre que estos la fueron recomendando ampliando así sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia started her business three years ago out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her family: her mom and aunts sell fried snacks and tamales, and they taught Patricia how to cook. Patricia took advantage of her knowledge to sell food to her neighbors, and little by little these neighbors recommended her to others, expanding her client base. Patricia needs a loan of US $250 to buy raw materials to sustain her business. She’ll repay the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Norma inicio su negocio porque tenia muchos gastos ya que 2 de sus hijos estudian la secundaria y el mas pequeño de 7 años esta en la primaria, fue entonces que para ayudar a su esposo busco una actividad que le brindara ingresos y con ayuda de su cuñada quien la enseño hace 2 años a vender productos plásticos ella poco a poco esta logrando una estabilidad económica a través de sus ventas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la falta de capital hace que se le caigan algunas ventas. Con tu ayuda Norma saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Norma began her business because she had a lot of expenses. Now her two older children are in middle school and the smallest, seven years old, is in elementary. To help her husband cover household expenses, Norma looked for a means of earning income. With the help of her sister-in-law, who taught her how to sell Tupperware two years ago, Norma is using her sales to slowly achieve economic stability. Norma is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise. She currently lacks the capital because her sales have fallen. She’ll repay the loan in three months. With your help Norma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth inicio el negocio porque quiere superarse y desarrollarse, además de apoyar en los gastos familiares a su esposo. Ella tiene 3 años dedicándose a la venta de productos de plástico para el hogar, y tiene la meta de ser distribuidora local de ese producto, con esfuerzo esta creciendo el número de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder distribuirla. Con tu ayuda Elizabeth lograra su meta.
texts.en:
Elizabeth started her business because she wanted to overcome her difficulties and develop herself, in addition to supporting her family's expenses along with her husband. She has worked on the sale of home plastic products for 3 years now, and her goal is of becoming the local distributor, and to grow the number of customers.

She is requesting a loan of U.S. $ 250, which she plans to pay in 3 months, and will use the loan to buy more goods to distribute. With your help Elizabeth will reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products.  (comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein C. is married and has 4 children. He 56 years old and lives in a small village close to the Lebanese town of Baalback in the Bekaa Valley. Hussein is a farmer and has been a client of Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) for 6 years. He has recently asked for a loan of $1,200 to help build a new home for his family. Hussein has a great history with Al Majmoua, and has always repaid his loans in full and on time.

loans.use: To help build a new home for his family

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 7 years ago after he quit working as a public van driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four. Currently, his monthly income is about US$ 1400.

Bogdan works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. This time he's faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle. He is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan to fix the body of his car and give it a fresher, nicer look.

Bogdan has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn't want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself.

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva comercializa víveres (azúcar, arroz y aceite) y pequeños artefactos (garrafas, ollas, vasos) a plazo de dos a tres meses con cobros diarios, su esposo trabaja en la Republica de Argentina de costurero. La pareja tiene dos hijos (uno tiene  un año, el otro tres). Eva  vine con su madre y paga el anticrético (especie de alquiler) de una casa ubicada en la Zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para incrementar su capital de operaciones.
 
Es su tercer crédito en Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Eva sells provisions (sugar, rice and oil) and small items (pitchers, pots, glasses) on two to three month installment plans with daily collections. Her husband works in Argentina as a tailor. The couple has two children (one is one year old and the other is three years old). Eva lives with her mother and pays the lease/security deposit (a type of rent) for a home located in the Rió Seco zone of El Alto city. The loan will be used to increase her operating capital. This is her third loan with Impro, her good payment history qualifies her for the current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital to purchase products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad D. is 35 years old and he lives in a small village close to Baalback in the Bekaa Valley. Ahmad owns a small grocery shop in his village and has had one previous loan from Al Majmoua, which he repaid on time. Ahmad will soon be getting married and has asked for a new loan of US$ 1,000 to help cover the costs of his wedding.

loans.use: To help cover the costs of Ahmad's upcoming wedding

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta is a married mom. She effectively manages her small business selling men's and women's clothing in a market of Pereschepino. She has been in this trade for nine years and presently her income is about $1200 a month.

Sveta is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivna ($US550). She is hoping to purchase additional merchandise and meet the needs of her customers.

Sveta is an entrepreneur of integrity and consistency. She has proven to be a reliable client working with Nadiya Ukraine. Her outstanding credit history secures prompt repayment of the current loan as well.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with a son. She lives in Novomoskovsk, Eastern Ukraine. Nina owns a small business in the local marketplace where she sells outer clothing and jackets at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 12 years. Currently, she has about $1400 of monthly income.

Nina is hoping to increase her sales. That is why she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($US650). Nina is very enterprising and strong-willed and has learned to tackle all sorts of problems. She knows how to rise above failure and go on bravely. Nina is determined to get more profit which will not only help her support her family but also keep her business moving forward as well.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a daughter. She is an enterprising business owner who works in the sphere of clothing sales. Svetlana runs a small business selling men's and women's clothing items in one of the most popular markets in Novomoskovsk. She has been in this trade for 11 years. Her income amounts to $1600 a month. Some of the strong characteristics of her business are its stability and the quality of merchandise offered.

Svetlana wants to get a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US550) to purchase a wide range of clothing items which will help her improve the quality of her inventory and get more customers. Svetlana is willing to take her business one step further. She is ready to face business risks because she has weighed all her decisions before committing to anything. Moreover, she is very devoted to the success of her business and has proven that she will be able to repay this loan without a problem.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa A. is 44 years old, married, and the proud father of 5 children. He lives in a small village close to Baalback in the Bekaa Valley. Mostafa owns a shop in town and sells cleaning products to the community. Mostafa has had 8 previous loans with Al Majmoua, all of which have been repaid on time. In order to provide a stable and inexpensive source of food for his family, Mostafa wishes to purchase a small plot of land near his house to grow produce, and has asked for a $1,200 loan to pay for this land.

loans.use: To fund the purchase of a small land plot for growing produce

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Jessica, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Comercio s/n cdra 2. Los clientes son las personas de los caseríos y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y niñas y de esa manera atender los pedidos que le hacen los clientes, quienes son la razón de su negocio.

Jessica tiene 31 años de edad, es natural de Bellavista, tiene un hijo quien es su motor para seguir trabajando. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace, más adelante piensa poner negocio en un local bien ubicado e implementarlo bien.
texts.en:
Jessica, a member of the communal bank "Las Orquídeas" (“The Orchids”), lives in the San Martín province in the Tarapoto district. She dedicates herself to the sale of women’s, men’s and children’s clothing. The business is located on Commerce Street. Her customers are people from the surrounding villages, as well as residents of the city itself.

With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy women’s clothes such as blouses and pants, and also children’s clothing (for boys and girls). In this way, she will be able to meet her customers’ orders since they are the reason for her business.

Jessica is 31 years old, and is originally from Bellavista. She has one son, who is her impetus to continue working. Her character is known as friendly, attentive toward her customers, calm, and confident in what she does. In the future, she hopes to place her business in a favorably-situated location and to keep it well-stocked.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Married with a child, Mavis T. is a 40-year-old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidotes to minimizing poverty, and for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in goods like eggs, maize, beans, peanuts, and yams. She has been trading for the past 10 years and has since been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize, beans, peanuts, eggs, and yams to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the trust group called "Adehye Mma," meaning royal children. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize, beans, peanuts, eggs, and yams

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de juanes el cual es una de las comidas tradicionales de la región. El negocio lo realiza en el frontis de su casa en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1393, lugar donde acuden los clientes, como también sale a entregar los pedidos que le hacen y lo distribuye a los Snaks de la ciudad.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de arroz, en saco, aceite en galón, también quiere implementar el negocio con la venta de salchipapas para lo cual necesita comprar un carrito salchipapero y los insumos para este negocio como las cremas en baldes, (Ketchup, mostaza), gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, también comprará los demás productos que a diario necesita para la preparación de sus juanes como gallina, hoja de bijao, aceitunas, etc., para atender a sus clientes y pedidos que le hacen.

Juan tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo, es una mujer responsable, cautelosa  y  trabajadora. Su meta es implementar el negocio con la venta de salchipapas por las noches.
texts.en:
Juana, a member of the communal bank "Las Orquídeas", lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She works selling juanes, a popular local dish of chicken, rice, olives and spices wrapped in a large banana-like leaf. She runs her business from the front wall of her home at 1393 Jr. Leoncio Prado; her clients come to the site to enjoy her food and she prepares her food there before making deliveries to clients and to fast food stores that distribute her products.

With this loan for 2500 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice by the sack and cooking oil by the gallon. She also wants to launch a business selling salchipapas, a popular fast food. To do so she needs to buy a cart from which to sell the salchipapas and the ingredients she will need to make the business a success, such as ketchup, mustard, and soft drinks in a variety of brands, sizes and flavors. She will also buy the ingredients she uses daily to prepare her juanes, including chicken, the big bajao leaves she wraps the chicken and rice in, olives, etc., in order to serve her clients and fill her orders.

Juana is 44 years old and lives with her husband. She is a responsible, cautious and hard working woman. Her goal is to launch the new business selling salchipapas at night.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will be invested in the purchase of rice and cooking oil and in the acquisition of a cart from which to sell fast food (salchipapas).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O., a 29-year-old merchant, is married with two kids. One kid is in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother. Esther helps her husband provide for the household through the sale of used clothing, and she also sells rice and stew with fish at Dunkwa Township where she lives around Obuasi.

Selling of used clothing is a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Esther. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing, a bag of rice and vegetables, etc. to increase her inventory. She believes this loan could help her to save more for her children's education. She is member of the group called Solid Rock. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing and foodstuffs such as bags of rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Aminata Collé

texts.fr: Aminata Collé Cissé, 40 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Face Néma depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut poursuivre son activité qui consiste à acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et du miel à Sindone et revendre au marché Grand Dakar. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aminata Collé Cissé is 40 years old and is married. She has been a member of the Boucotte Face Néma village bank for the past four and a half years. Her business, which she is keen to keep going, consists of buying palm oil, lemon juice and honey in Sindone and selling it at the Grand Dakar market The income from her business allows her to improve her family’s living conditions.

She is requesting a loan that will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Señora Julia, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en la región  y  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, café y cacao. Cuenta con bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Bolognesi  Nº 239, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes que son los mayoristas de la localidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000, el cual será cancelado en 6  cuotas, comprará  cacao, maíz, café en grandes cantidades a los productores para poner a le venta a los mayoristas y los recolectores de estos granos que llegan de Tarapoto. Quiere tener bien surtido el negocio y aprovechar las cosechas que hay por su localidad.

Julia tiene 35 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su esposo es quien la apoya en el negocio. Su  meta  es continuar con el negocio y llegar a ser mayorista y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Julia, a member of the communal banl "Judith Tuanama", lives in the region and province of El Dorada, in the San José de Sisa district. She works selling grains and beans such as corn, coffee and cacao. She has been workiing in this business for some time now, and the business is going well for her. Her business is located in her home at 230 Jr. Bolognesi. The local wholesalers who are her clients come daily to that location to buy from her.

With this loan for 2000 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will buy cacao, corn and coffee in large quantities from the producers, in order to later sell it to the wholesalers and other bulk buyers of these products who come to her town from Tarapoto to buy. She wants to have the business well stocked and to take advantage of the good harvest in her local area.

Julia is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children. Her husband helps her in the business. Her goal is to continue with the business and to one day be a wholesaler with her own warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of coffee, cacao and corn

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been preparing foods like gari and beans as we call it, with fried ripe plantain to serve loyal customers in the neighborhood.

Gari and beans are eaten both in the morning and in the afternoon and Georgina has been doing this business for the past 3 years; she says selling of this food is very nutritious and very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family. Georgina is a member of the group called Amazing Grace Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like plantains, gari and beans

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana G. is a 34 year old woman. She is divorced due to marital problems, and she has two kids. Juliana is a very hard worker. She enjoys sales work and for the past two years her major source of livelihood has been cosmetic sales. Juliana says selling cosmetics is lucrative, and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table at the community market. She also sometimes travels from house to house to meet and deliver products to all of her customers.

With a loan, Juliana believes that she will have more resources to purchase additional stock of cosmetics and jewelry to increase her inventory and income. She is a member of Amazing Grace group. Members in this group provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a 55-year-old divorced mother of 5 children. She is really industrious and she works with the motivation of supporting her children's education to provide them with better life opportunities in the future. At the moment, 3 of her children have successfully completed senior high school.

She also sells plantains, beans, and yams in the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral to access loans and use peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plantains, beans, and yams

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B., 50 years old, is a widow with four children. They are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells yams, plantains and bags of maize. She has been selling these products for the past ten years and has since been very resourceful to her family.

Afua wants to use the loan to buy in bulk a supply of plantains, bags of maize, and yams, etc. to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country.She believes this will also enable her to decrease her cost very significantly so as to increase savings to pay for her children's schooling. She is a member of the trust group called Isaiah. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy in bulk a supply of plantains, bags of maize, and yams

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah E. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high school. Jemimah sells fish which she buys from the fishermen for processing, the she makes them attractive to her costumers at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman. Jemimah uses her income to pay for feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Jemimah will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jemimah plans to help her husband in the putting up of the family house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Joseph Ben

texts.en: Joseph Ben E. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Joseph sells fishing net, lead ropes and other fishing materials at Elmina, which he has done since 2002. His wife is a trader. Joseph uses his income to pay for the children's school fees and other utility bills. Joseph will use the loan to add to his capital to increase stock for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi F. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’un dépôt de planches à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il aimerait, avec ce crédit, faire d’avantage de stocks en bois afin de répondre aux besoins de la population qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Avec cette chance de Kiva, Koffi espère augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et par là ses profits afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi F. is 45 years old, married, and the father of four. He is the owner of a lumber warehouse in Adeta, a village located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He would like to use this loan to have more inventory of wood in order to respond to the needs of the population, which is continuously growing. With this Kiva opportunity, Koffi hopes to increase his sales figures and thus his profits, so that he may provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. sells jewelry and bread at Elmina. Cecilia has received a senior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader. Cecilia has been selling jewelry and bread since 2002. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of her children's school fees, the feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase stock for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva  vive en la calle Unión Fátima  de la zona villa cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos. 

Se dedica al la venta ambulante de productos de belleza por lo cual recibe un porcentaje.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Eva lives on Unión Fátima street in the Villa Cooperative area of El Alto city. She lives with her mother and siblings. She is a traveling vendor who sells beauty products, and she receives a percentage of her sales. The loan will be used to buy merchandise. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies her favorably for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy beauty products to resell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina K. is married and has 5 children. She has never received schooling. Christina sells food items like maize, beans, pineapple, gari and other items at Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a farmer. Christina uses her income to help her husband in the payment of her children's school fees, the feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills. Christina will use the loan to add to her capital to increase stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to support with her children's schooling.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Essivi A. est âgé de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des habits « prêts-à-porter », à Adeta, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant des pagnes et habits pour la revente. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de  ses enfants
texts.en:
Essivi A. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is a retailer of “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth) and of ready-to-wear clothing in Adeta, a village located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to increase her business capacity by buying pagnes and clothing for resale. The profits from her business will enable her to take care of her children better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and clothing for resale

loans.name: Milenium Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las “MILENIUM”, se fundo el 12 de Noviembre de 1998, actualmente se encuentra en el II ciclo 16 mujeres y 6 varones, es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito Calca en la calle Bolivar Nº 128 a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, las actividades económicas a las que se dedican son el comercio de productos agrícolas  y servicios venta de comidas dentro del mercado y artesanía. El banco comunal tiene 10 años de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio.
“El ahorro lo utilizo para que mi hija estudie en Cusco” “He mejoR. mi casa con el ahorro”,  "Mi hija puede estudiar ahora con luz electrica" son algunas expresiones de las socias que nos alienta a seguir trabajando bancos comunales. Calca esta ubicado en el Valle SagR. de los Incas, en la cuenca del rió Vilcanota, cuenta con un clima templado. Los días de feria local son los domingos, es cuando las socias realizan sus actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
The community bank "MILENIUM", was founded on November 12, 1998. Its members consist of 16 women and 6 men, who live in the Calca district on Bolivar Street No. 128. It is located 50 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. The economic activities of those engaged with this bank are trade in agricultural products and services involving the sale of food and crafts at markets. The community bank has been in operation for 10 years, and its members are happy and satisfied with its services of loans, savings and training it offers. The following are some quotes from members who encourage the use of community bank services: "I use the savings for my daughter to study in Cusco", "I've improved my house with the savings," "My daughter can now study using light from electricity." The Calca district is located in the Valle SagR. de los Incas (the sacred valley of the Incas), in the Vilcanota River basin, which has a temperate climate. The local fair days fall on Sundays, and this is when the members conduct their business activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of this community bank typically use their loans in order to purchase more merchandise to grow their business. ( Las socias del banco comunal, destinan sus creditos para actividades de comercio, principalmente es capital de trabajo, para incrementar el stock de mercaderia, acopiar productos.)

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua T. sells food items like maize, rice, gari and other items at Elmina. Ekua has received no formal education.  She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Ekua has been selling food items since 1994. She is responsible for the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase stock for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support with her children's schooling.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. sells a local dish called 'Kenkey' which is eaten with fried fish. She prepares this food herself and sells it at Kokoado in Elmina. Agnes has received no formal education. She is divorced and has 3 children.

Agnes has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2000. She is financially responsible for feeding her family and for their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize, fresh fish and other ingredients for the preparation of the kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her growing customer base. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, fresh fish and other ingredients for the preparation of  kenkey

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Maricela está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la barda y un portón a la casa ya que no está segura.

Maricela trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de elaboración de artículos de electrónica (Sonidos, televisiones, computadoras y etcétera) esté es su ingreso ella vive solo su familia está en Veracruz.

Es por eso que la Sra. Maricela solicito un préstamo de $850.00 dlls. Para comprar el materia para la elaboración de la barda y colocación de un portón y así su casa esté mas segura cunado ella este trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricela is asking for a loan to build a fence and gate around her house, because at the moment it is not secure. Maricela works in a factory that makes electronics (music players, televisions, computers, etc.). Maricela lives alone, and her family is in Veracruz. Maricela is asking for a loan of $850 Diz to buy the materials to complete the fence and gate, so that her house will be secure while she is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a fence and gate

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maricruz vive con su mama a ellas les esta haciendo falta un cuarto mas ya que la casa está muy reducida ella quieres construir una recamara en la planta alta de la casa para así ampliar mas la sala y cocina. 
Maricruz trabaja como vendedora de productos de belleza esté es su ingreso familiar ella tiene una hija de edad escolar.
La Sra. Maricruz está solicitando un préstamo de $925.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricruz lives with her mother, and they’d like to build and additional room for their small house. They’ll build it on the upper floor of the house to expand the living room and the kitchen as well. Maricruz works selling beauty products and this is the family’s main source of income. She has a school-age daughter. Mrs. Maricruz is asking for a loan of $925 dlls to build the room for herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty B. is a wife and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a thirty-one-year-old merchant who sells charcoal and smoked fish. Charcoal is a very popular source of heat for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes.

Through this business, Gifty has supported her first-born to complete junior high school. Gifty obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and smoked fish to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more  charcoal and smoked fish for re-sale

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Luz Esperanza, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería, útiles escolares, ropa y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, situado en el Jr. San Martín s/n, lugar donde acuden los clientes que en su mayoría son sus amigos y los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de productos en oferta como desodorante, esmalte, shampoo, perfume y joyas, también en pasamanería como cierres, hilos de todos los colores, blondas, y útiles escolares como cuadernos, cola, lapiceros, lápices, etc. Quiere que su negocio este bien surtido para atender las necesidades de los clientes.

Luz tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en las decisiones que toma. Ella es una persona responsable y con mucho poder de decisión. Le gusta el negocio y quiere más adelante contar con una zapatería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Esperanza, a member of the communal bank "Picota", lives in the San Martín region of Peru in the province and district of Picota. She works selling sewing trim, school supplies, clothing and beauty products.The business is located in her home on Jr. San Martín. The friends and neighbors who are her clients come to her site to make their purchases. With this loan for 1500 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the purchase of products such as deoderant, fingernail polish, shampoo, perfume and jewelry as well as sewing supplies such as zippers, a variety of threads, laces and school supplies including notebooks, glue, ballpoint pens, pencils, etc. She wants her business to be well stocked in order to serve her clients' needs. Luz is 44 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her decisions. She is a responsible and decisive person. She likes business and wants to someday own a shoestore.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
El Sr. Reyes se dedica a la elaboración de block desde ya hace mas de un año esté es su ingreso familiar de el depende su esposa y un hijo.

El Sr. Reyes esta solicitando un préstamo de $850.00 para la comprar de materia prima (cemento) ya que tiene detenidos barrios pedidos para entregar pero no a podido por falta del material el no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra materia y así entregar los pedidos que tiene a tiempo y su clientes lo recomienda con otras personas.
texts.en:
Mr. Reyes has been in the cinder block business for more than one year. His business is the only source of income for his family. Reyes is asking for a loan of $850.00 to buy raw materials (cement). He doesn’t currently have the capital to purchase these materials and this has delayed Reyes from filling various orders on time. He’d like to make his orders on time so that his clients recommend him to others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Lita tiene un taller de mecánica, lugar donde reparan todo tipo de vehículos menores. El taller está ubicado en su propio domicilio en Jr  Bolognesi Nº 1638. Los clientes son mayormente los motocarristas de la ciudad.
 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará aceite, repuestos y accesorios diversos para vehículos motorizados por docenas. Dado la buena acogida que tiene, quiere implementar un taller con la venta de algunos repuestos, sobre todo lo que más requieren los clientes, quienes a diario llegan al taller con motos para ser reparadas, además encuentran en este establecimiento lo necesario para seguir operando con una buena máquina.   

La señora Lita tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Es una persona perseverante, luchadora y anhela más adelante tener un negocio de venta de repuestos y lubricantes.
texts.en:
Lita, a member of the communal bank Las Orquídeas, lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto. Lita has a mechanic's shop where she offers repairs on all sorts of small vehicles. The shop is located in her home at 1638 Jr. Bolognesi. Her clients are primarily the motorcycle owners who work as motorcycle taxis in the city. With this loan for 1200 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will buy large quantities of oil, replacement parts and a variety of accessories for motorized vehicles. Given the good reception her business has received from the local people, she wants to open a shop selling replacement parts, especially those parts her clients most frequently need. Every day clients come to her shop with motorcycles in need of repair. What's more, they find in her shop everything they need to keep their vehicle running well. Lita is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is a person who perserveres and who fights to get ahead. She dreams of one day having a business selling vehicle lubricants and replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil, replacement parts and a variety of accessories for motorized vehicles.

loans.name: Lith Angelica

texts.es:
La Señora Lith Angelica, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y a la compra y venta de cacao. El taller que maneja está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Perú Nº 1111, y el negocio de venta de granos lo realiza en Pucacaca, que es uno de los pueblos donde se cosecha en gran cantidad este producto y luego lo vende a la planta de chocolates.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, para confeccionar y luego vender en el pueblo donde va en busca del otro producto. También invertirá en cacao, ya que en estos meses tiene bastante demanda porque están próximas las fiestas de fin de año.

La señora Lith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora. Su meta es crecer en el negocio, contar con un local en la ciudad para que le sirva de almacén y llegar a vender cacao y otros granos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lith Angelica belongs to the Communal Bank “The Orchids”. She lives in the province of Saint Martin, district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to the making of clothes, and the buying and selling of coco beans. The tailor shop that she runs is located in her home in the Jr. Perú N 1111, and the business of selling coco beans takes place in Pucacaca. Pucacaca is one town where the coco bean is harvested and later sold to the chocolate factories. With this loan of 2,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, Lith will buy different color threads, different kinds of fabrics in order to produce and later sell in the town where she will look for other products. Also, she will invest in coco since in these up coming months there is sufficient demand due to the year end celebration. Lith is 27 years old and lives with her husband and small child. She is an intuitive and optimistic woman. Her goal is to grow her business and eventually acquire her own location in the city in order to serve as a warehouse and sell coco beans and grains at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of threads and investment in the purchase of coco beans

loans.name: Livith

texts.es:
La señora Livith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín,  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa, se dedica a  la  venta de ropas para damas caballeros y niños y todo tipo de correas y bolsos, desarrolla su negocio en el mercado de la ciudad, sus clientes son las personas que a diario visitan el mercado a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, pantalones, shorts, ropa interior, gorros y toallas de diferentes, colores. Livith desea surtir bien el negocio para asegurar las ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y aprovechar la cosecha de maíz, pues ese producto mejora aún más las ventas.

La señora Livith tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos, quienes aún dependen de ella. Se caracteriza por ser muy optimista y perseverante. Su meta es contar con un local propio para asegurar y hacer crecer el negocio ya que vende en el suelo, en un espacio del mercado.
texts.en:
Livith belongs to the Communal Bank “Judith Tuanama”. She lives in the area of Saint Martin in the province of El Dorado district of San Jose de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sale of clothing for women, men, and children, and all types of belts and bags. Her clients consist of the people who visit the market daily, and whom she tends to very pleasantly. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in the purchase of materials for her store such as inventory. Livith hopes to improve her business to secure her sales, and satisfy the needs of her clients. She also wants to take advantage of her harvest of corn, which will improve her sales even more. Livith is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who still depend on her. She is characterized as being very optimistic and perseverant. Her goal is to own her own store to secure, and grow her business since up until now she sells from the floor in a space in the market.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cloths for Men Women and Children

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La Sra. Gricelda es madre soltera y tiene dos niños de edad escolar ella nos esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de uniformes y útiles escolares  ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero. 
Gricelda trabaja en una farmacia en el aria de cajera esté es su ingreso familiar ella renta un cuarto para vive ella y sus dos niños cuando se va a trabajar una vecina le cuida niños. 
La Sra. Gricelda nos está solicitando $300.00 dlls para la compra de uniformes t útiles escolares para su hijos  para que no pierda el años escalar.
texts.en:
Gricelda is a single mother who has two school-age children. She is requesting a loan from us in order to purchase uniforms and school supplies since, at this time, she does not have enough money.

Gricelda works in a pharmacy as a cashier. This is her family income. She rents a room, in which she and her children live. When she goes to work, a neighbor takes care of her kids.

Gricelda is requesting $300 to purchase uniforms and school supplies so that her children do not lose out on their school years.


Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Llinith

texts.es:
La señora Llinith, socia del Banco Comunal “ Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 111. Los clientes son  sus amigos, familiares y vecinos de su barrio. Los productos de belleza lo trabaja en base a pedidos por catálogos. 
 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos para surtir más el negocio como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche en cajas, detergente, conservas, aceite, entre otros, también comprará repuestos para su carro el cual es una herramienta indispensable de trabajo de su esposo ya que brinda servicio de transporte interurbano.

Tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es tener una tienda bien surtida en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad, otra de sus metas también es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Llinith belongs to the Comunal Bank “Judith Tuanama”. She lives in the area of Saint Martin in the province of El Dorado district of San Jose de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sale of non perishables and beauty products. The business is run out of her home in the Jr. Sinchi Roca N 111. Her clients are friends, family, and neighbors of her neighborhood. The beauty products she sells come through the orders she makes through a catalog. With this credit of 1,500 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy products grow her business such as rice, sugar, milk, detergent, canned goods, oil, and more. Also she will buy spare parts for her husband’s car which is necessary to perform his work of intercity transportation. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who still depend on her. It has always been emphasized that she is a dedicated woman, hard worker, and great organizer. Her goal is to have a store in a strategic location in the city. Also, she wants to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, oil, non perishables, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Sr Guadalupe M. esta construyendo en su casa pero le está haciendo falta las bardas de enfrente y el portón y algo mas de material.

El señor Guadalupe M. es una persona pensionada el motivo fue porque sufrió un accidente en su trabajo que lo dejos incapacitado pero eso no le a impedido salir adelante con su familia. Con su pensión y algunos trabajos de construcción que el realiza son las ingresos de su familia. Cuando fuimos a realizar la visita a su casa el Sr. Guadalupe no se encontraba andaba haciendo un trabaja solo se encontraba su esposa la Sra. Esther y sus nietos.

El Sr. Guadalupe fue acreditado de Fvp es un bien cliente el esta solicitándole otro por medio de Kiva por $750.00 dlls que es para comprar el material que le esta haciendo falta para terminar las bardas y portón y así su familia este mas segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe M. is building at his house but he lacks a wall and a gate in the front since he does not have enough materials.

Guadalupe M. is a person who lives off of a pension since he suffered a work accident that left him disabled. However, this did not impede his ability to get his family and himself ahead. He generates income for his family through his pension and some odd jobs. When we visited Guadalupe's home, we found only his wife, Esther, and their grandchildren.

Guadalupe is accredited by FVP and has been a good customer. He is requesting another loan from Kiva in the amount of $750 which is to purchase the material that he lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. El negocio está ubicado en un  puesto del mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad en el Jr. Alonso de Alvarado C-09. Se dedica venta de comida y le va muy bien por el trato amable y carisma que le caracteriza, a ello se le suma la buena sazón y la variedad en los platos que ofrece, también cría animales (cerdos y gallinas) para luego venderlos.  

Con este crédito de S/.1000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará  insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y otros insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, también invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales y poder venderlos en el tiempo previsto.     

La señora Lucia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos, quienes la apoyan en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer muy activa. Tiene como meta crecer en el negocio y tener una granja para criar sus animales, además menciona que el negocio si es rentable.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank “The Orchids”. She lives in the region and province of Saint Martin in the Tarapoto district. Her business is located in the market stand number 02 of the city in Jr. Alonso of Avarado C-09. She specializes in the sale of food and it is going very well for her due to her good nature and charisma. Added to that she provides great flavors and a variety of dishes. She also breeds animals (pigs and chickens) in order to later sell them.

This credit of 1000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 installments, will be used to buy ingredients needed for the preparation of her dishes. For example, sugar, rice, oil, packaged noodles, and other consumables that she buys daily like meet, chicken, pork, and fish. She would also invest in the purchase of feed for her animals and try to sell them a head of time.

Lucia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and one of her children. Her family supports her, and she is a very active woman. It is worth mentioning that her business is profitable and her goal is to grow her business and have a farm to raise her animals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purches of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Lucila Flora

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de muebles, y para ello Lucila y su esposo tienen una carpintería y ella es quien la administra porque es contadora de profesión. Su esposo es quien la apoya en los contratos con sus clientes y le va muy bien con esta actividad, además está contenta con los resultados del negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará madera de todo tipo como caoba, ishpingo, cedro y otros insumos que necesita para realizar un buen trabajo y quedar bien con los clientes que en su mayoría son los colegios, banco de materiales y las Municipalidades.  

Lucila tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo porque sus hijos. Desde muy joven se destacó por ser una mujer entusiasta, trabajadora, responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener una ladrillera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila is a partner in the Communal Bank “Picota”. She lives in the San Martín region and province, in the district of Picota. Lucila sells all kinds of furniture, and Lucila and her husband own a carpentry workshop. Lucila is the business administrator, because she’s an accountant by training. Her husband helps her make contracts with clients and is happy with the results of the business. With this loan of 1,000 soles Lucila will buy several types of wood, including mahogany, ishpingo, and cedar. She’ll also buy other supplies needed to do good work and keep her clients happy. Her clients are mostly high schools, supply banks, and municipalities. She'll repay the loan in six payments. Lucila is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children. Since she was young, Lucila has been enthusiastic, hard-working, responsible, and persevering. Her dream is to own a brick-making business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy several types of wood

loans.name: Lud

texts.es:
La señora Lud, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa.
