Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cosméticos y ropa. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, en el Jr. Comercio Nº 444. Los clientes son los vecinos, amigos y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, shorts, camisas y pedidos que le hacen los clientes, también quiere invertir en perfumes, desodorantes, los cuales son productos que más le solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Lud tiene 39 años de edad, es natural de Sisa, vive con su esposo y sus 3 últimos hijos, a quienes anhela verlos profesionales. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y atenta con los clientes. Más adelante quiere ver bien surtido el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lud, partner of the communal bank "Judith Tuanama", lives in the state of San Martín, province of El Dorado, district of San José de Sisa. She sells a variety of food products, cosmetics, and clothes.Her business is located at her own home, in the Jr. Comercio Nº 444. Her clients are her neighboors, friends, and people who live in the same city. With this loan of 340 dollars, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to invest in the purchase of polos, blouses, shorts, and shirts for men, women, and children alike. She also wants to invest in the purchase of perfumes and deodorants, products with high demand at her store and that have a high turnover. Lud is 39 years old, she was born in Sisa, lives with her husband and her last 3 children, whom she wants to see as professionals in some area. She is characterized as being gentle and caring with her clients. Further ahead she plans to further stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/ She will invest in the purchase of clothes for men, women, and children

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier le acaba de entregar su casa por medio de Infonavit pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones. 
Javier trabaja en una compañía de seguridad privada en el aria de guardia de seguridad y su esposa la Sra. Antonia trabaja limpiando una casa esté es el ingreso de ellos.
El Sr. Javier atenido ya un crédito con Fvp  que fue para la diferencia que tenia para que le adquirir su casa ya  termino el crédito con Fvp  y está solicitando un por medio de Kiva para poner las protecciones a su vivienda ya que el y su esposa trabajan todo el día y no esta nada segura.
texts.en:
Javier just received his house by means of Infonavit, but he is lacking in protection. Javier works at a private security firm as a guard and his wife, Antonia, works cleaning a house. These activities comprise their income. Javier has already had a loan with FVP, which made the difference in his finishing his house. He is seeking a loan through Kiva to add protection to his house, given that he and his wife work all day long and their belongings are not secure.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection for his house.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La Señora Ludith, socia D. Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de  ropa interior y prendas para damas, también vende gaseosas, gelatinas y chupetes. El negocio lo realiza en su casa en el Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 177. Trabaja en base a pedidos, los clientes suelen ser sus amigos, familiares y hermanos de su congregación, de su iglesia, a quienes ella los trata muy bien y de esa manera mantener la clientela y asegurar las ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas para la confección de este tipo de prendas, de diversos colores, elásticos, blondas y una máquina de coser, y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar los trabajos de confección. También quiere invertir en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas para implementar el negocio en su casa.

Ludith tiene 42 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, su meta es seguir creciendo, tanto en el taller de costura como en el negocio de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ludith, partner of the communal bank Las Orquideas, lives in the San Martin province, district of Tarapoto. She sews underwear and clothes for women and sells soft drinks, jelly, and candies. She works from her house at Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 177. Her production is based on the requests she receives; her clients tend to be her friends, family members, and brothers of his congregation, whom she treats wonderfully, securing a stable demand for her products. With a loan of 670 USD, which she will repay with 6 payments, she will buy threads of different colors, fabrics for the confection of clothes, elastics, and a sewing machine. This way she will have all she needs to continue with her business. She also wants to invest in the purchase of soft drinks and candy to consolidate the business at her place. Ludith is 42-years-old, she lives with her husband and her two children that still depend on her. She is a positive and entrepreneurial woman, and her goal is to continue growing with her sewing workshop as in the business of her house.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará hilos, telas, elásticos, blondas y una máquina de coser./ She will buy threads, fabrics, elastics, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora  Magna, socia del BC “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y gaseosas, y por las noches vende juanes y anticuchos. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr. Fernando Belaunde Terry, lugar donde atiende a los clientes, los cuales son los vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará gelatina en gran cantidad, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, arroz, aceite y otros productos que necesita para la preparación de los juanes y anticuchos como pollos, aceitunas, huevos, etc. y que los clientes encuentren lo que les guste, ya que uno de sus secretos para mantener a los clientes es atender sus gustos.

Magna tiene 62 años de edad y vive con su esposo. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, quien desea seguir creciendo en el negocio. Su meta es contar con un local para aperturar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magda, member of the “Picota” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, province and district of Picota. She dedicates herself to the sale of J-ELLO and soft drinks. At night she also sells tamales and kebabs . Her business is situated in her home at Jr. Fernando Belaunde Terry, where she attends her clients, many of whom are neighbors or passers-by visiting her district. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which she will repay in 6 installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of J-ELLO, different brands, sizes, and flavors of soda, rice, oil, and other ingredients necessary to make the tamales and kebabs such as chicken, olives, eggs, and so forth. As one of her business secrets is catering to her clients’ particular tastes, variety is essential to her business. Mrs. Magda is 62 years of age and lives with her husband. She considers herself a very hardworking and responsible woman, who wishes to keep expanding her business. Her ultimate goal is to own a local to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing large quantities of J-ELLO, sodas, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región  y  provincia de  San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, útiles escolares, pasamanería y artículos para regalos. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. San Pedro Nº 253, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, quienes son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para  surtir bien su negocio y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Maria Elena tiene 44 años de edad,  vive con su esposo quien la apoya en el negocio en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace. Su meta es continuar con el negocio, seguir creciendo y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena, member of “Las Orquídeas” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. Her main business is the sale of groceries, school supplies, sewing trimmings, and gift items. She has been in this business for a while, and it is going well for her. Her store is located in her own home in Jr. San Pedro No. 253, and her clients—mostly neighbors and friends—frequent her business daily. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy essential products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, non-perishables of different sizes, toys, toilet paper, detergent, and soaps of different brands and sizes to better supply her business and meet her customers demands. María Elena is 44 years old and lives with her husband—who helps her run the business in his free time. She is a hardworking and charismatic woman. She enjoys what she does and would very much like to continue her business. Her ultimate goal is to continue with and keep expanding her business and to have it stocked to both her and her clients’ satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing essential products (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc).

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados. El negocio se ubica en el mercado de la localidad, lugar donde tiene un puesto de venta y donde acuden a diario a comprar gran cantidad de clientes. También reparte a las señoras que venden comida y bodegas de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 2,200, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará pollos en grandes cantidades para luego sacrificarlos y poder proveer a sus clientes de la ciudad, además comprará ganados para criarlos y venderos cuando sea necesario.

Orfith es una mujer entusiasta de 28 años de edad. Se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos, pues tiene asegurada su venta. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orfith, member of the “Judith Tuanama” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, El Dorado province, district of San José de Sisa. She makes a living selling chickens whose entrails have already been removed. Her business is situated in the local market, where she has a regular stand and where large quantities of clients frequent daily. She also sells to neighborhood women who sell food and to grocery stores around the city. With this loan of S/.2,200, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of chickens to slaughter as necessary to provide for her clients. She also hopes to buy livestock, which she will raise and sell when necessary. Mrs. Orfith is an enthusiastic woman of 28 years of age. She is happy to be given the possibility of reaching her proposed objectives. Her ultimate goal is to further expand her business and to see her children enter a profession.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchasing of chicken.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the capital for her work

loans.name: Rolith

texts.es:
La señora Rolith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, Provincia de El Dorado, Distrito de San José de sisa. Rolith es estilista y cosmetóloga, tiene un salón de belleza en donde también vende  productos de belleza. El salón está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Nereo Cabello C-06, en donde espera a sus clientes para atender  con mucha amabilidad sus gustos en cortes, tientes y tratamientos de belleza.
 
Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, además implementará el salón con tintes, tijeras y productos para tratamiento de rostro.

Rolith tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es comprar un andamio para ampliar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rolith, member of the “Judith Tuanama” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, El Dorado province, district of San José de Sisa. Mrs. Rolith is a hair stylist and makeup artist. She owns her own beauty salon where she also sells beauty products. The salon is located in her home at Jr. Nereo Cabello C-06, where she attends her clients wishes, providing haircuts, dye jobs, and beauty treatments. With this loan of S/.2,000, which she will repay in six payments, she hopes to buy beauty products such as perfumes for women, men, and children, deodorants, jewelry, nail polish, and lotions. Also, she hopes to replenish her salon with new hair dyes, scissors, and face treatments. Mrs. Rolith is 40 years of age. She lives with her husband and three children whom are still dependent on her. She has always prided herself on being a hardworking and dedicated businesswoman. Her ultimate goal is to buy shelves to expand her business with the sale of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products, hair dyes, scissors, and face treatments.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja diariamente cuidando de ovejas,  para luego vender su carne, también cría cuyes, pero en menor proporción, lleva a pastear a sus ovejas a espacios abiertos durante casi todo el día, y cerca al anochecer los regresa a su establo. Cuando sus animales están listos, planifica la distribución de la carne en varios lugares, como carnicerías y bodegas cercanas a su casa.Es más rentable comprar los animales vivos y vender su carne, que sólo comprar la carne al por mayor para distribuirla.Lidia disfruta de esta actividad porque le gustan los animales y le permite vivir tranquila.
Solicita este préstamo porque desea comprar más animales para hacerlos engordar, además para invertir en sus tierras y mejorar sus cultivos de pasto.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children. She works every day taking care of sheep in order to later sell their meat. During the day, she takes these sheep out to the field so they can feed themselves. When her animals are ready, she sells their meat to butcher shops and warehouses close to home. It is more productive to buy the animals alive and then sell their meat, than just buy their meat in large amounts in order to distribute them. Lidia enjoys this activity because she likes animals and because it gives her tranquility. She requests this loan because she would like to invest in the purchase of more animals and make them fatter. She also wants to invest in the land and in improving the quality of the grass from which her animals feed themselves. She also raises cuyes in smaller proportions,

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of animals that she currently has and improve the quality of the grass from which these animals feed themselves

loans.name: Rosa Llane

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín,  Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Perú Nº 935. Los clientes son sus amigos, padres del aula de sus hijos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
 
Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es ampliar el negocio y seguir creciendo en esta actividad, además de llegar a ser una promotora estrella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa, member of “Las Orquídeas” Community Bank, lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto District. She sells beauty products. The business is run out of her own house at Jr. Perú, No. 935. Her clients are her friends, the parents of her children’s classmates, neighbors, and relatives. She takes orders. With a loan of S/.1,500, to be paid in six installments, she will buy beauty products on special offer such as perfume for women, men, and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotion, etc., in order to supply her business, increase her profits, and reinvest. Rosa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children, whom still depend on her. She has always stood out for being determined, hardworking, and a good manager. Her goal is to expand her business and to continue growing in this activity, as well as become a star promoter for her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Susan Magali

texts.es:
La señorita Susan Magaly, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería por catálogos. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Nº 159. Los clientes son sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
 
Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfume para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Susan tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y a pesar de su corta edad es muy  decidida y trabajadora. Su meta es comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, llegar a tener una boutique y terminar la carrera de Derecho.
texts.en:
Miss Susan Magaly, a member of the “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo” Communal Bank, lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Morales District. She sells beauty products and lingerie through catalogues. She runs the business out of her own house, No. 159 on Jr. Augusto B. Leguia. The clients are her friends, coworkers, neighbors, and relatives. She takes orders. With this loan of S/.800, to be paid off in four installments, she will buy beauty products like perfume for women, men, and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotion, etc., so she can supply her business, increase her profit, and reinvest. Susan is 21 years old, single, and despite her young age is very determined and hard-working. Her goal is to buy a display cabinet for her products, get a boutique, and finish her Law degree. .

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Teresa Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú, actividad que lo realiza en el puesto de venta que está ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, lugar donde acuden diariamente los comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. No le faltan clientes por su buena sazón, variedad de los platos que oferta y la atención que brinda a los clientes. 

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparación diaria de los platos que oferta a los clientes como verduras, carnes (res, cerdo, pollo, pescado), también invertirá en el arreglo de su casa para acondicionar el negocio más adelante.

La señora Teresa tiene  34 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, quien es su motor para seguir luchando y trabajando día a día. Es una mujer decidida, tiene como meta tener un restaurante en su propio domicilio para atender a los clientes con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa Lilia A. belongs to the “Picota” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region, in the provincial district of Picota. She dedicates herself to the sale of menu-type food, selling from her stand in the local market. People from the neighborhood and visitors from nearby communities go to the local market daily to eat. Ms. A. attracts many clients because of the good seasoning she uses on her food, the variety of dishes on the menu, and the good restaurant service she provides for her customers. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy rice, sacked sugar, several gallons of cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients for the daily preparation of the vegetarian, beef, pork, chicken, and fish dishes she offers on the menu. She is also investing in home improvements in order to prepare her business for the future. Mrs. A., 34, is a single mother who lives with her son, who gives her strength to keep fighting and working every day. She is very determined, and her goal is to open a restaurant in her home that better attends to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Hace más de 20 años, Betty (39), viene dedicándose a la venta de variedad de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en uno de los terminales de transporte terrestre interprovinciales de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese pequeño negocio logró brindarle bienestar a su familia, pero ahora que sus hijos se encuentran siguiendo sus estudios superiores le demandan mayor gasto económico, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la venta de boletos de viaje, obteniendo ingresos económicos extras por cada pasaje  que vende.Su deseo es adquirir variedad de galletas y chocolates  de la ciudad de Tacna y distribuirlos al por mayor a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, con esos ingresos  que obtenga logrará cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
For more than 20 years Betty (39) has been selling a variety of candy and soft drinks for a living at one the the interprovincial ground transportation terminals of the town of Juliaca. With this small business she was able to offer well-being to her family, but now when her children are going on with higher education the economic costs have increased and therefore she decided to sell travel tickets to obtain some extra income. It is her wish to purchase a variety of cookies and chocolate bars at the town of Tacna in distribute in bulk to the storekeepers in the town of Juliaca and thus obtain earnings to cover her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of cookies and candies to improve business.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo es un ejemplar y respetable padre y esposo, hace algunos años estuvo dedicado a la venta de ropa, pero  conforma  iba obteniendo ganancias  con esta actividad alquiló un local e  implementó poco a poco su pequeño restaurante, actualmente  su local está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia, por lo que la demanda de sus deliciosos potajes va en aumento, el ingreso que percibe por esta actividad le ayuda a la manutención de su familia, constituida por su esposa y una hija.El deseo de Justo, y por lo que solicita este préstamo, es ampliar su restaurante, para más adelante ahorrar lo suficiente y comprar un motocarro, para que en sus horas libres pueda brindar servicio de transporte a la población.
texts.en:
Justo is a respectable and exemplary husband and father. Several years ago he used to sell clothing, but as he saved his earnings from that business he was able to rent a space which he eventually turned into a small restaurant. His restuarant is located in a very busy area, so demand for his delicious vegetable stew is growing. The income he earns from his restaurant helps Justo support his wife and daughter. Justo is requesting this loan so that he can expand his restaurant. He hopes to save enough to eventually buy a motorcycle taxi so that he can provide transportation in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve restaurant

loans.name: Higinia

texts.es: Las salteñas que prepara Higinia con apoyo D. sus hijos son muy demandadas en la ciudad D. Juliaca, esta familia inicia con la  preparación D. sus  ricas salteñas (empanadas rellenas con carne y pollo) desD. las 3:00 D. la madrugada  hasta las 9:00 D. la mañana, luego las distribuyen en los diferentes snacks,  y puestos, y quioscos D. los centros educativos.Esta dedicada madre se siente muy satisfecha con esta actividad, porque en muy corto tiempo viene obteniendo muy buenas ganancias, permitiéndole así  brindarles una buena educación a sus 2 hijos, quienes en sus horas libres la  apoyan alegremente en esta actividad, al mismo tiempo la llenan D. dicha y orgullo porque responden favorablemente en sus estudios.En esta oportunidad, requiere D. un préstamo, dinero que será invertido en  la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. sus agradables salteñas.
texts.en:
The “salteñas” (pastries filled with meat, vegetables and spicy sauce) that Higinia prepares with the help of her children are in demand in the city of Juliaca. This family works in the preparation of the delicious salteñas (filled with beef and chicken) from 3:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. then, they are distributed in different snack stores, stands, and in educational centers. This dedicated mom feels fulfilled with this activity because in a very short period of time she has obtained good profit, which has allowed her to proviD. a good education to her two children, who help her with this activity in their free time, they also make her proud and happy because they are good students. At this time, she requires a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare salteñas.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare delicacies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, como toda madre preocupada por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos, trata de desenvolverse en diferentes actividades para generar ingresos económicos y así ofrecerle educación a su hijo Darwin de 18 años.Su deseo más grande a es ver a su hijo con una profesión y un futuro promisorio, por esa razón, decidió trabajar en una prestigiosa farmacia de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus conocimientos sobre medicamentos, su  disponibilidad y buena la atención que brinda, hacen incrementar la cantidad de clientes.Adicionalmente a esta labor, se dedica a la artesanía, generando de esa manera  ingresos extras para la tranquilidad  y estabilidad de su hogar.En esta oportunidad, requiere obtener un préstamo, para poder inscribir a su hijo en una  academia pre universitaria, con el fin de  que  reciba  una buena  preparación para que postule y logre ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda, just like any mother concerned with the education of her children, works in different areas in order to produce some revenue and offer a education to Darwin, her 18 year old son. Her dream is to see her child as a professional and with a promising future. Because of this reason, she decided to work in a prestigious pharmacy in the city of Juliaca. Her knowledge of medicaments and her demeanor help increase the amount of clients that visit her. In addition to this job, she also works as a handcraft, generating in this way the extra revenue for the tranquility and stability of her home. In this opportunity, she requests a loan to sign up her son in a preparatory academy so that he is prepared to go to college when he graduates.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inscribir a su hijo en una academia pre universitaria. / Incribe her son in a pre-college academy.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad  en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene  gran cantidad  de  solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool so she can sew in order to be able to meet the demand of her clients.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La venta de queso es el sustento principal de Rosa, joven empeñosa de 23 años de edad, con muchísimas ganas de prosperar en la vida, se viene dedicando a este oficio desde hace 2 años, empezó apoyando a sus hermanos mayores, pero al aprender rápidamente, decidió hacer de este oficio, su principal ingreso económico.Adquiere su mercadería los fines de semana en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, para luego enviarlas al por mayor al mercado de la ciudad de Arequipa, donde tiene gran clientela asegurada.Esta actividad de compra y venta de queso le está permitiendo cubrir  satisfactoriamente sus estudios de contabilidad, ahora, el deseo que tiene esta joven es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The sale of cheese is the main source of income of Rosa, a young and hardworking 23-year-old woman with a lot of dreams for her future. She started working in this business two years ago, when she began supporting her older brothers. As she learned more, she decided making this activity her principal source of revenue. During the weekends she buys the cheese in different small towns around Juliaca, in order to sell large quantities of this product to the city of Arequipa, where the demand for cheese is large. This selling and buying of cheese has allowed her to cover the costs of studying accounting; now, the dream of this young woman is to invest in her business and see it grow.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business of selling cheese

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una amorosa y abnegada madre de 4 hijos, está dedicada al negocio de venta de productos por campaña y al tejido de enaguas, estas actividades, las desempeña  habidamente, con lo que puede apoyar a su esposo  con los gastos de su hogar. Ahora, tiene pensado comprar nueva y variada mercadería y materiales para su confección de enaguas, por lo que solicita este préstamo, Silvia cree  que  con este negocio y el trabajo que realiza su esposo, brindando servicio de movilidad urbana en su triciclo, mejorarán sus ingresos económicos  y la calidad de vida de sus 4 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is the loving and self-sacrificing mother of four. She works selling seasonal products and weaving traditional Peruvian petticoats. She engages in these activities regularly in order to help her husband with household expenses. Currently, she intends to buy new and varied merchandise as well as materials to make her petticoats; this is why she is seeking a loan. Silvia believes that, with this business and with her husband's work in urban transportation services, they will have more income and will thereby be able to improve their four young children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise and materials for making petticoats.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto es un comerciante de 33 años de edad del Rancho La Reforma, comunidad localizada en Montemorelos Nuevo León.

Jorge Alberto inicó su negocio hace 5 años, en un principio se dedicó a la venta de pacas para ganado, es importante señalar que su surgimiento como microempresario se dio derivado de la necesidad por autoemplearse y contar con una fuente de ingresos para atender las necesidades de su familia. La familia de Jorge Alberto se compone por su esposa e hija de 6 años de edad.

Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por US $350 a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, lo cual ayudaría a contar con un mayor surtido en su negocios. ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Jorge Alberto y así ayudemos a las actividades del campo mexicano!
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is a 33-year-old merchant from the ranch La Reforma, a community in Montemorelos Nuevo León. He currently asks for a 320 USD loan for four months for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, a purchase that would allow him to diversify his businesses. Jorge Alberto began working here five years ago; he began selling a rodent called a paca in the livestock market, He lives with his wife and his 6 year old daughter. I invite you to support Jorge Alberto and thus help the activities of Mexican agriculture!

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semillas y fertilizante

loans.name: Ni Putu Yeni Kiswanti

texts.id: Putu Yeni adalah seorang ibu muda yang tinggal di desa Manistutu yang jauh dari keramaian kota. Putu hidup bersama dengan suami dan anaknya yang berumur 6 tahun. Putu menekuni usaha ternak babi karena harus membantu penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani dimana memang dirasakan tidak cukup memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga di jaman sekarang ini. Dalam menekuni usahanya Putu tergabung di kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI memberi pengaruh yang sangat bagus untuk perkembangan usaha ternak babinya. Untuk jangka waktu pemeliharaan 5 bulan Putu Yeni bisa mendapat keuntungan sampai Rp.500.000,-. Karena itulah Putu Yeni melanjutkan kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui pinjaman yang kedua. Pinjaman berjangka waktu 6 bukan ini akan digunakannya untuk menambah populasi ternak babinya dengan membeli 3 ekor bibit penggemukan disamping induk babi yang sudah dimilikinya. Dan sisa dari pembelian bibit akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Diharapkan dengan bertambahnya jumlah peliharaan serta pinjaman yang semakin meningkat maka bisa dimanfaatkan untuk membeli pakan yang lebih berkualitas sehingga akan menghasilkan panen yang lebih baik dari sebelumnya dan pada akhir periode nanti bisa mengembalikan pinjaman dari DINARI. Program DINARI secara ekonomi memang memberi dampak yang baik bagi keluarga Putu Yeni.
texts.en:
Putu Yeni is a young housewife lives in Manistutu village, away from a crowd of a city.putu lives with her husband and their 6 years old son. She is running a pig breeding business to help her husband, a farmer with low income, in fulfilling their family’s daily needs. Putu Yeni is a member of Kembang Mekar, a group of pig breeders. The first loan earned from DINARI gave a good impact that in 5 months, Putu Yeni was able to earn up to Rp 500,000 income. That is why she proposed to earn the second loan. The proposed loan will be a 6 months period loan with repayment on the end of the period. Putu Yeni will use the loan to purchase 3 more piglets; the rest will be used to purchase fodder. She hopes by the increase of the number of the piglets and the more capital she manages, she will be able to earn more. DINARI program really gives a good impact for Putu Yenis’s economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sibu

texts.id: Meskipun sudah berusia lanjut tetapi Nengah Sibu tetap ulet berusaha meningkatkan usaha ternak babinya. Tergabung dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar, Nengah sekarang hanya memelihara babi penggemukan saja tanpa induk tetapi hasil yang dicapai cukup lumayan. Sehingga bisa membantu suaminya yang seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang pas-pasan dalam memenuhi kebutuhan ekonomi keluarga serta mampu menyekolahkan seorang anaknya sampai bangku kuliah. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan bagus yaitu Rp.400.000,- selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Sekarang dengan pinjaman kedua yang berjangka waktu 6 bulan ini Nengah Sibu mencoba menambah babi peliharaannya sebab dari perhitungannya akan memberikan keuntungan yang lebih baik lagi. Dan ditambah lagi dengan pembinaan dari staf DINARI pastinya usaha Nengah Sibu akan tambah maju. Untuk pembayaran pinjaman kembali ke DINARI akan dilakukan pada bulan ke 6 diakhir periode pinjaman. Ternak babi inilah salah satu yang diharapkan Nengah Sibu dapat menolong ekonomi keluarganya. Keuntungan yang didapat sangat berguna bagi pencukupan kebutuhan sehari-hari terutama untuk kuliah anaknya.
texts.en:
Eventhough Nengah Sibu has been quite old; she is still passionate in running her pig breeding business. Being a member of Kembang Mekar group, Nengah only raises piglets but is able to earn good income that helps her husband, a farmer with a low income, to afford their family needs as well as to support their children in pursuing college degree. First loan earned from DINARI gave her a good income, i.e. Rp 400,000,- for 5 months period. The current proposed loan is a 6 months loan that is aimed to purchase more piglets in order to get higher income. The repayment will be done at the end of loan period. Nengah is confident that her business will be getting better, especially with capacity buildings given by DINARI staffs to improve the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Ni Ketut Astuti

texts.id: Keseharian Ketut Astuti memang bekerja di ladang bersama suaminya yang ternyata hasil dari mengolah ladangnya itu tidaklah bisa sepenuhnya mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Akhirnya untuk lebih meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga, Ketut Astuti memilih untuk mengambil usaha ternak babi dan ikut di kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar untuk mendukung pekerjaan suaminya. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 800.000,-, Ketut membeli induk babi dan kemudian ditambah dengan pinjaman dari DINARI periode I  mampu menambah modalnya yang kemudian dibelikan 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Setelah 5 bulan, hasil yang didapat sangat bagus dengan keuntungan mencapai Rp. 1000.000,- setelah dipotong biaya pakannya. Selanjutnya dengan pinjaman periode II dengan jangka waktu yang sama yaitu 6 bulan ini Ketut berencana akan membeli induk babi satu lagi untuk bisa menghasilkan lebih banyak bibit yang bisa dijual. Pengembalian pinjaman akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman setelah pemeliharaan selama sekitar 6 bulan. Program DINARI yang menjangkau para peternak babi ini sangat membantu Ketut dalam menekuni usahanya sebagai peternak babi. Keuntungan yang dihasilkan juga sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga serta membiayai keperluan sekolah anaknya.
texts.en:
Everyday, Ketut Astuti helps her husband working on farming field. The income they get from cultivating the farm unfortunately is not too big that could not fulfill all their daily needs. Finaly, to increase the family’s economic condition, Ketut Astuti chose to breed pigs and joined Kembang Mekar, a group of pig breeders. She started the business with Rp 800,000,- as the initial outlay and deployed the capital to purchase a pig. Then Ketut Astuti earned additional capital from DINARI and used it to purchase another 4 piglets. After 5 months, she was able to earn Rp 1,000,000 net income. Ketut Astuti plans to use the loan proposed from DINARI to purchase another pig to breed more piglets that can be sold. The proposed loan is a 6 months loan, with the repayment will be done on the end of the loan period. DINARI program for pig breeders really helped Ketut Astuti in running her pig breeder business. The income she earns is helping her to fulfill the family’s needs and to support her children education funds.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Ni Ketut Noli

texts.id: Hidup di desa dengan pekerjaan sehari-hari sebagai petani yang mengolah ladang bersama suaminya dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu membuat Ketut Noli sekeluarga hidup dalam kesederhanaan. Usaha ternak babi yang juga ditekuninya pun tidak terlalu banyak membantu karena kurangnya modal untuk mengembangkan usaha ternaknya. Setelah mendapat penjelasan tentang program DINARI melalui staf pembina maka Ketut yang kemudian masuk dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar mencoba peruntungan dengan meminjam modal ke DINARI. Pinjaman pertama berjalan dengan lancar setelah dibelikannya 4 ekor babi penggemukan dan melalui pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan serta tambahan training dari staf DINARI, penjualan babi Ketut Noli berhasil meraup keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- per bulannya. Hasil menguntungkan ini mendorong Ketut untuk melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu selama 6 bulan yang langsung dibelikannya bibit induk babi dengan harapan nantinya akan menghasilkan anak-anak babi yang bisa dijual. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Keuntungan dari pinjaman pertama membuat Ketut Noli semakin bersemangat menekuni usaha ternak babinya disamping masih rutin ke ladang setiap harinya. Adapun untuk pengembalian pinjaman akan dihitung pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dengan hasil ini Ketut mampu membiayai kebutuhan anaknya yang masih sekolah kelas 2 SMA serta mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga sehari-hari.
texts.en:
Ketut Noli is a farmer that works her family owned field with her husband. Her uncertain farming income makes her live frugally. Her pig farm did not help much in supplementing her income due to insufficient funding to develop the farm. After getting introduced to DINARI and obtained additional training, Ketut joined Kembang Mekar farming group. She also sought funding help from DINARI. She used her first loan to purchase 4 fattening pig. After 5 months, she sold those pigs for $20 profit per month. This result compelled her to seek second loan with 6 months tenor to be used to purchase piglets to be grown and sold later. The rest of the money will be used to purchase feeds. Hopefully from the increased profit, she can pay for her child who is in junior yr in high school and pay her daily living expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 34-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. She is a tailor who makes clothes in the local village.

In her business, Mrs. Yang S. now faces a small problem because her sewing machine is too old and cannot produce a good product for her consumers so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to make a good product for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Mrs. Soth S. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Phen Phat, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns only a meager income to support his family.

 In Mrs. Soth S.'s plantation, she now faces an infertile soil which has made her crop output decline. Thus, Mrs. Soth S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her crops. She would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects. 

Mrs. Soth S. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three remaining are attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to support her crops

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sitri

texts.id: Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga Ketut Sitri tergolong wanita yang ulet. Selain membantu suaminya Wayan Lungguh bekerja sebagai petani, Ketut Sitri juga memelihara babi di belakang rumahnya. Setelah bergabung di kelompok Kembang Mekar dan mengajukan pinjaman pertama ke DINARI, Ketut membeli satu ekor induk babi disamping 3 ekor bibit penggemukan yang sudah dimilikinya. Selain itu sisa pinjaman juga digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Setelah 5 bulan dipelihara Ketut menjual anak-anak babi dari induk peliharaanya dan berhasil mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 200.000,- per bulannya. Itu belum termasuk keuntungan dari penjualan 3 ekor babi penggemukan modalnya sendiri. Selanjutnya pada pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu sama yaitu 6 bulan, Ketut akan menambah 4 ekor bibit penggemukan dan tetap memelihara induknya juga. Nantinya dengan penambahan populasi babi ini akan diperoleh hasil yang lebih bagus lagi dari sebelumnya sehingga pinjaman DINARI juga bisa dikembalikan pada akhir periode pinjaman dan bisa segera dilanjutkan lagi dengan pinjaman selanjutnya. Karena hasil dari beternak babi ini sangat menjanjikan bagi Ketut Sitri dalam meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sitri is a very diligent housewife. Besides helping her husband, Wayan Lungguh farming, Ketut Sitri also owns a pig farm in her backyard. Fater joining Kembang Mekar group and sought first loan from DINARI, Ketut bought a pig. She previously has farmed 3 pigs. The loan was also used to buy feeds. After 5 months, the matured and fattened pigs were sold for $20 net profit per months. She is seeking second loan with 6 month tenor to purchase 4 piglets. Hopefully with these additional pigs, she cna earn more profit to pay back the loan and bring additional profitt to help her family's finances.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em C. lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is far from irrigation and she cannot generate water to support her field, Mrs. Em C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump for this purpose and she hopes to produce a better crop to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Sam Yorng, assists his wife in the field. Mrs. Em C. is 68 years old and the mother of three children who are all married and they usually give some money to support their parents because they are too old. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a pump to water her field

loans.name: Ni Komang Wenti

texts.id: Memiliki 3 orang putri yang 2 diantaranya sudah duduk di bangku sekolah tentu sangat membebani keuangan keluarga Komang Wenti yang sudah pas-pasan. Disamping juga harus mencukupi kebutuhan lainnya. Suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dengan hasil yang tidak terlalu banyak membuat Komang harus ikut berusaha mendukung ekonomi keluarga. Untuk itulah Komang berusaha dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar. Dengan modal sendiri serta pinjaman dari DINARI, Komang mampu membeli 3 ekor induk babi dimana setelah 6 bulan memelihara induk babi tersebut menghasilkan masing-masing 5-6 ekor anak babi. Setelah dijual keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah dipotong biaya pakannya mencapai Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam kurun waktu 6 bulan. Melihat hasil yang bagus ini, Komang melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan juga dan rencananya akan dibelikan pakan yang lebih berkualitas bagi 3 ekor induk babinya tersebut sehingga anak-anak babi yang dihasilkan akan bertambah banyak dan berkualitas bagus. Program pinjaman ke peternak babi dari DINARI dengan pelunasan pinjaman pada akhir periode di bulan ke 6 ini dirasakan sangat menolong Komang Wenti untuk mengembangkan usahanya dan hasilnya sangat membantu Komang untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Komang Wenti needs to afford tuition for her 3 daughters, two are in school already. She also needs to pay for her daily living expenses. Her husband is a farmer with uncertain and limited income. Komang is compelled to help her family's finances by farming pigs in her backyard. With her own money and additional loan from DINARI, Komang managed to purchase 3 breeding pigs. After 6 months, they produced 6 piglets that was sold for $150 profit in 6 months. After this encouraging result, she was encouraged to seek second loan from DINARI that she will use to purchase higher quality feeds for her 3 breeders, so they produce higher quality piglets. She feels that DINARI's flexible loan structure helps tremendously in developing her business. She plans to use the additional profit to pay her daughters' tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Feeds

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng L. was born in 1950 and now lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province.  She is a tailor who uses cloth to process into clothes for the villagers.  In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase a new sewing machine to replace the old one in order to produce better quality for her customers.  

Her husband, Mr. Khoem Khat, is a Khmer priest who usualL. works in funerals and wedding ceremonies to make a small income to support his famiL..  Mrs. Heng L. has five children, four of whom are employed in different business activities while the youngest is attending school.  Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine in order to produce better quality for her customers.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

texts.id: Meski tergolong ibu yang masih muda dan baru mempunyai seorang anak yang sudah duduk di kelas 1 SD tidak membuat Ketut Sumarmi bisa bersantai-santai dengan kesehariannya. Kebutuhan hidup yang semakin meningkat mendorong Ketut untuk bekerja lebih keras membantu suaminya yang seorang karyawan swasta dengan gaji yang pas-pasan. Disamping mengolah ladangnya, Ketut juga memelihara babi di rumahnya dan ikut dalam aktifitas kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar di desanya. Dengan meminjam ke DINARI lewat program KIVA, Ketut mampu membeli 1 ekor induk babi serta pakannya yang kemudian dipeliharanya selama 6 bulan menghasilkan keuntungan Rp. 500.000 dari penjualan 6 ekor anak babinya. Karena keuntungan yang lumayan bagus, Ketut melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu yang sama yaitu 6 bulan dan kembali dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi serta sisanya untuk pakan. Sekarang Ketut berhasil memelihara 2 ekor induk babi dan selama 6 bulan kedepan besar harapan Ketut untuk menghasilkan anak babi yang lebih banyak lagi sebab para pembeli bibit sudah menantinya. Pinjaman ini nantinya akan dikembalikan pada akhir masa pinjaman. Hasil yang dicapai Ketut sangat membantu keuangan keluarganya sehingga keperluan dan biaya sekolah anaknya pun bisa terpenuhi.
texts.en:
Being a young mother whose child sits in first grade, Ketut Sumarmi cannot be lazy. Ever rising living cost motivates Ketut to work hard to help her husband who works as a private employee with barely sufficient salary. Besides workin gin her rice field, Ketut also farms pigs in her home through Kembang Mekar group. Through a loan from Kiva channeled through DINARI, Ketut bought a breeder pig and feeds. She bred the pig for 6 months and earned $50 profit from the sale of 6 piglets. Due to the excellent result, Ketut is requesting a second loan with 6 month tenor to purchase additional breeder pig and feeds. With the 2 breeding pigs, Ketut hopes to produce more piglets in the next 6 month that can be sold ot her regular clients. The profit from her farm will be used to supplement her family's finances and pay her child's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase breeder pig an feeds

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok P. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is too far from irrigation, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to generate water to support her field.

Her husband, Mr. Chea Phat, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Thuok P. is 54 years old and the mother of seven children. Six of them are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a pump to generate water to support her field

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs Thuy S. was born in 1958 and she lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a cow breeder who raises nine cows. Her husband, Mr Chhit Beoun, is a construction worker. Mrs Thuy S. has seven children two of whom are employed in garment factory while another one is tailor.

Even though Mrs Thuy S.'s family has more than one business, they still cannot afford to build a new house so Mrs Thuy S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house to replace the old one.

Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house for her household.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Pori

texts.id: Wayan Pori adalah gambaran seorang istri sekaligus ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet membantu suaminya bertani serta mengembangkan usaha ternak babi sebagai pekerjaan lainnya. Ternak babi memang ditekuninya sejak lama terbukti Wayan tergabung dalam kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar dan setelah kerja sama dengan DINARI, Wayan mampu meningkatkan mutu babi peliharaanya. Pinjaman pertama digunakannya untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi serta pakannya. Selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan diperoleh keuntungan dari penjualan babinya sebesar Rp. 800.000,-. Ini bisa terjadi berkat ketekunan dari Wayan Pori memelihara babi serta pendampingan dari staf DINARI sendiri. Setelah melewati pinjaman pertama dengan hasil menggembirakan, Wayan Pori memutuskan untuk melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Pinjaman ini berjangka waktu 6 bulan lalu dibelikannya 5 ekor bibit babi penggemukan serta pakannya. Wayan berharap hasil bagus pada pinjaman pertama akan merembet ke pinjaman kedua sehingga dengan demikian hasilnya akan meningkat karena populasi babinya bertambah. Pinjaman ini akan dilunasi pada akhir masa pinjaman. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Wayan sangat menolong keluarganya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari serta keperluan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Wayan Pori is a very diligent housewife. She helps her husband work the field and farm pigs on the side. She has been farming pigs for a long time. She is also a part of Kembang Mekar farming coop that is affiliated with DINARI. Through training from the group, Wayan was able to increase the quality of her farmed pigs. She used first loan obtained from DINARI to purchase 4 piglets and feeds. After 5 months, she sold the pis for $ 80 profit. This result was due to her own diligence and DINARI's technical assistance. Motivated by the success of her first loan cycle, she is currently seeking second loan for $175 with 6 months tenor. She plans to use the money to purchase 5 fattening pigs and feeds. Wayan is hopeful that she can earn more profit from more pigs. She will use the additional profit to help her family's daily finances and raise her kids.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Farmer Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vat K. C. is the leader of a group of four in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who now does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Soth Sengleang, is a house constructor who can only make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Vat K. C. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three remaining are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate rice in her field

loans.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.id: Tinggal di pedesaan tentunya hanya bertani saja yang bisa ditekuni Wayan Subeg bersama suaminya. Hasil dari mengolah ladang yang tidak menentu dan tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga membuat Wayan meningkatkan usaha ternak babinya sebagai pekerjaan sampingan. Wayan memutuskan untuk bekerja sama dengan DINARI dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar yang merupakan program dari DINARI sendiri. Pinjaman pertama yang diperoleh Wayan digunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi serta pakannya. Pemeliharaan yang dilakukan sangat sederhana dengan kandang yang seadanya saja. Setelah 5 bulan dipelihara, induk babi tersebut menghasilkan 8 ekor anak babi yang kemudian dijual menghasilkan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1000.000,-. Dari hasil ini Wayan melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan besar Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan pengembalian yang kemudian dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi lagi serta pakan yang lebih bermutu dari sebelumnya. Oleh sebab itu Wayan berharap keuntungan yang diperoleh pun akan meningkat. Program DINARI ini menurut Wayan sangat baik untuk peningkatan penghasilan keluarganya yang dulunya pas-pasan sekarang menjadi lebih mapan. Karena Wayan masih harus menyekolahkan anaknya di bangku SD serta memenuhi kebutuhan anak keduanya yang masih bayi.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Subeg and her husband are farmers living in the village. However, the uncertain income is often not enough to fulfill all her family's needs. This motivated her to farm pigs to supplement her income. Wayan decided to seek financial and technicla assistance from DINARI through Kembang Mekar farming group. She used the first loan to purchase 1 breeder pig and required feeds. She used simple farming techniques. After 5 months, the pigs produced 8 piglets that brought her $100 profit. This encouraging result made Wayan apply for second loan for $175 with 6 months tenor. She plans to use the fund to purchase an additional breeder pig and higher quality feeds. She hopes that her earnings will increase. She thinks that this DINARI progrma is very useful in increasing her family's income and improve her family's quality of life. Wayan still need to pay her kid's tuition money and fulfill the needs of her second infant child.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Pigs and Feeds

loans.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
Cô Lê Thị Mai 48 tuổi, mã số thành viên 06030006 cô là người phụ nữ rất chịu khó. Cô làm khá nhiều nghề như chăn vịt đẻ, hiện nhà cô có 200 con. Ngoài ra cô còn làm 360m2 trồng rau muống bán hàng ngày, chồng cô chăn trâu thuê. Vi vậy tổng thu nhập hàng của gia đình khoảng 160.000đ/ ngày. Với số tiền đó cô có điều kiện cho 5 đứa con đi học. Cô đã trả hết vốn chu kỳ trước và tiếp tục làm đơn xin vay chu kỳ 2 với số tiền là 3.360.000đ để mua vịt và cám để chăn nuôi. Trong nhóm cô còn có 5 thành viên khác cùng vay vôn

.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt 40 tuổi mã số 06030008 vay 3808.000đ, thời gian vay 12 tháng để mua thêm hoa quả về bán
  • Lưu Thị Lan 24 tuổi mã số 06030009 vay 4.256.000đ,thời gian 12 tháng để mua gà giống( gà thịt)
  • Kiều Thị Hồng mã số 06030010 vay 5.152.000đ, thời gian 12 tháng để mua gà giống (gà đẻ)
  • Nghiêm Thị Thanh mã số 06030005 vay 4.704.000đ, thời gian vay 12 tháng để mua máy làm mỳ
  • Nguyễn Thị Thành mã số 06030033 vay 3186.000đ, thời gian vay 6 tháng để mua cám chăn nuôi gà đẻ, với mức trả 135.000đ / tuần.
texts.en:
Ms. Lê Thị Mai, 48 years old, no 06030006. She is a very hard-working housewife with many activities, like raising egg-laying ducks (currently 200). Besides, she also grows 360 square meters of water spinach to sell every day. Her husband works as a buffalo herder. With all of this, the family's income is about 160.000đ per day, and allows her take care of her 5 school-age children. She has already paid back all the previous loan and has applied for a second loan of̀ 3.360.000đ in order to buy ducks and duck feed. There are 5 other borrowing members in her group

.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt, 40 years old, no 06030008, is borrowing 3.808.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and resell fruit
  • Lưu Thị Lan, 24 years old, no 06030009, is borrowing 4.256.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and raise meat chicken
  • Kiều Thị Hồng, no 06030010, is borrowing 5.152.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and raise egg-laying chicken
  • Nghiêm Thị Thanh, no 06030005, is borrowing 4.704.000đ over 12 months to buy a noodle machine
  • Nguyễn Thị Thành, no 06030033, is borrowing 3.186.000đ over 6 months to buy chicken feed. She intends to pay back 135.000đ per week.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicken and ducks

loans.name: Thi Bich Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Chị C. Thị Bích Hằng 30 tuổi, mã số 06030034 chị và cả nhóm lần đầu tiên tham gia vay vốn của SEDA. Tháy các chị em phụ nữ trong thôn vay vốn chị cũng tìm hiểu cách thức vay trả. Sau khi được cán bộ tín dụng tư vấn chị rất thích tham gia vì được tiết kiệm trả dần.Chị đăng ký tham gia vay 3.186.000đ về lấy thêm cám để bán cho các hộ chăn nuôi trong làng.Chị có 2 con đang đi học, trồng chị cũng giúp chị nhiều trong công việc buôn bán. Trong nhóm chị còn có 4 thanh viên nưã cung tham gia vay vốn

.
  • Chị Lưu Thị Bắc 35 tuổi, mã số 06030035 vay 3.186.000đ trả trong 6 tháng về mua cám chăn nuôi gà đẻ
  • Chị Đinh Thị Tập 58 tuổi mã số 06030036 vay 3186.000đ để mua lợn giống
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân 33 tuổi mã số 06030037 vay 3186.000đ mua ngô nổ bỏng
  • Anh Kiều Văn dũng 24 tuổi mã số 06030038 vay 3186.000gg mua gà để nuôi
texts.en:
Ms. C. Thị Bích Hằng, 30 years old, no 06030034. Her group is borrowing for the first time from the SEDA fund. All the housewives in the group worked together to find ideas to invest and pay back the loans̉. She is very eager to adhere to be able to save and repay gradually. She is asking for a loan of 3.186.000đ to buy animal feed and resell at the market to the village farmers. She has 2 school-age children, who also help her out when there is a lot of sales activity. There are 4 other Fund participants in her group

.
  • Ms. Lưu Thị Bắc, 35 years, no 06030035, borrowing 3.186.000đ over 6 months to buy chicken feed
  • Ms. Đinh Thị Tập, 58 years, no 06030036, borrowing 3.186.000đ to buy pigs
  • Ms. Nguyễn Thị Vân, 33 years, no 06030037, borrowing 3.186.000đ to buy corn for use as animal feed
  • Mr. Kiều Văn, 24 years, no 06030038, borrowing 3.186.000đ to buy chicken to raise

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying animal feed

loans.name: Asad

texts.en:
Asad U. is the father of 3 children and one of the residents of Ningarhar Province. He is 31 and graduated from class twelve. Asad and his two brothers are living with their parents in a small rental house in Behsood district; his father is an official and his two brothers are studying in a public school.

Asad U. is an electrician; he has been working in this field for about ten years. Before that he was a tailor, but he says that he wasn't able to solve all his financial problems through this business, therefore he changed it, and after one year of private studying, he became an electrician.

Asad is a hard-working man; he can cover his family expenditures, such as house rent, shop rent, or buying other necessary goods for the house. Recently Asad decided to purchase some new electrical equipment for his shop, and through it expand his business as much as possible, because he thinks that he couldn't provide all the things needed for his clients, therefore he had to buy it. But Asad doesn't have enough money in hand, so he has requested that AFSG give him a 50,000 Afghani loan to achieve his goal.

Asad U. dreams of creating a large electrical store and recruiting other workers to his business. Also he thanks the lenders who make possible this opportunity for people like him to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical equipment for his shop

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Ten years ago, this 46-year-old man was a military officer, but now he has a bicycle repair shop. He is Noor M., the father of 8 children, and a resident of Ningarhar Province. He lives in a rental house which has just two rooms and a small yard.

Noor M. worked as military officer for about 12 years. At that time, he was single, but when he got married, he left his job and started a business, because he thought he might not be able to provide for all his family expenditures on 2000 Afghanis (US$ 40) monthly salary. Therefore he opened a bicycle repair shop, and still now he is working there.

Noor has four sons; the older one is working as a blacksmith, but the three others are studying in public school. Meanwhile they are helping their father in their spare time.

A few months ago, Noor has decided to buy a car to use as a taxi for his son and some equipment for his shop, because he wants to pave the way for his other three sons to just keep at their studying. For this purpose, he needs to expand his business more and increase his daily income. This was the reason that he requested a 50,000 Afghani individual loan from AFSG , to make his dreams come true.

Finally Noor M. hopes the lenders will provide this opportunity for him, to utilize his capability. Also he thanks them a lot.

loans.use: To buy a taxi  and equipment for his shop

loans.name: Bosiljka

texts.en:
Bosiljka Ristić was born in 1953. She is divorced and she lives with her two children. She works in a bakery earning 300 KM monthly. She has also another income of making cakes at home.

This will be her first loan with WWI in the amount of 600 KM ($US450). She wants to buy materials for making cakes at home, so she will sell more cakes after work time and in that way her life and life for her children will be easier.

loans.use: To buy materials for making of cakes.

loans.name: Madi

texts.ru: Гафуров Маъди житель района А.Джоми. Возраст 34 года, женат , имеет 3 детей.Образование средние. Клиент более 7 лет занимается  выращиванием овощей. Он имеет небольшой участок земли.Каждый год ,собрав урожай он делает запасы на свою семью,а остальное реализует на местном рынке. Этот вид деятельности помогает ему прокормить свою семью.Так как сельское хозяйство является единственным источником дохода его семьи.В данный момент клиент хочет закупить  качественные семена.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 4 месяцев
texts.en:
Madi G. is a resident of the Jomi district. 34-years-old, he is married and has three children. He attended secondary school, and has raised sheep for more than seven years. He has a small parcel of land. Each year after gathering in the harvest, he keeps a portion for his family and sells the rest at the local market, an endeavor that helps him to feed his family. Agriculture is his family’s sole source of income. Now he wishes to purchase high-quality seed. He plans to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of high-quality seed

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Худойдодова Салтанат жительница района А.Джоми. Возраст 68 года, вдова,имеет 1 сына. Образование среднее. Занимается куплей продажей  сельхоз.животных более 30 лет.Помогает клиентки ее  сын. Вместе они покупают на местном рынке молодых бычков или барашкев,откармливают их и перепродают по более выгодной им цене.Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода их семьи.Сейчас Салтанат планирует закупить одного бычка,на что и берет кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saltanat H. is a resident of the Jomi region. She is a 68-year-old widow with one child. Saltanat attended secondary school, and has purchased and sold farm animals for more than 30 years. She is assisted by her son. Together, they buy calves and lambs at the local market and fatten them for resale at a profit. This business is the sole source of income for their family. At present Saltanat plans to purchase a steer and is taking out a 12-month loan for that purpose.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: увеличение денежного оборота Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru: Худойназаров Алимардон житель района А.Джами. Возраст 52 года, женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается животноводством.Имеет опыт в этой деле 25 лет. Этот  бизнес позволяет ему содержать его большую семью.Так как кроме него  никто не работает.Жена занимается домашним хозяйством,а дети учатся .Алимардон покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков ,откармливает их в течении 45 дней и продает на рынке. Клиент планирует купить на кредит очередного бычка для откормки. Планирует погасить  кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alimardon H. is a resident of the Jomi region. He is 52 years old and married with five children. He completed high school and has 25 years of experience raising livestock, a business that permits him to support his large family. He is their sole source of income, as his wife is a homemaker and his children are in school. Alimardon purchases young steers locally, fattens them for 45 days, and then puts them on the market. With this loan, he plans to buy his next steer for fattening. He will repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Halimabi

texts.ru: Холова Халимаби жительница района А.Джоми.Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование средние.Клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством.Она  имеет небольшой участок земли на котором выращивает овощи. Собрав урожай излишки она реализует на рынке или обменивает на другие продукты питания,такие как мука, рис и масло. На кредит планирует закупить семена и минеральные удобрения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 4месяцев.
texts.en:
Halimabi H. resides in the Jomi region. 30-years-old, she is married and has two children. She attended secondary school, and works in agriculture. She has a small parcel of land on which she raises sheep. After gathering in her crop, she sells the surplus at the market or barters for other food products such as flour, rice and oil. With the loan she plans to buy seed and fertilizer. She intends to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru: Ходжаев Садриддин житель района Хуросон. Возраст 23 года, женат , имеет1 ребенка. Садриддин  более 3 лет занимается сельским хозяйством.Он выращивает кукурузу. Собрав урожай он обеспечивает кормом свою корову,кур.Сделав запасы на год,лишние клиент реализует сосядям по выгодной ему цене. В данный момент Садриддин хочет купить минеральные удобрения ,что бы получить более качественный урожай.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadriddin H. resides in the Khuroson district. The 23-year-old man is married and has one child. For more than three years Sadriddin has worked in agriculture. He grows corn. Upon gathering in his crops, he provides his cow and chickens with feed, then puts away enough for the next year. The remainder he sells to his neighbors at a profit. Sadriddin presently wishes to purchase fertilizer in order to improve his crops. He intends to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Рахимова Гульбахор жительница района Хуросон.Возраст 43 года,замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей сельхоз.животных.Она покупает на местном рынке молодых барашкев,откармливает их и продает по выгодной ей цене. Занимается этим бизнесом более 3 лет. На доход от эттого бизнеса она содержит она содержит свою семью.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.В данный момент клиентка планиурет  купить 3 баранов.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Gulbahor R. is a resident of the Khuroson district. 43-years-old, she is married and has four children. She attended secondary school, and now engages in the buying and selling of farm animals. She buys young lambs locally, fattens and sells them for a profit. Gulbahor has been in this business for three years, and on the income from this endeavor she supports her family since her husband is temporarily unemployed. At present, she intends to purchase three sheep, and plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three lambs

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru: Алиев Одина житель  города Куляб. Возраст 47 лет, женат , имеет 5 детей. Клиент на местном рынке имеет небольшую торговую точку ,где торгует мясом.Он покупает на местном рынке сельхоз.животных ,откармливает их .После откормки продает их мясо на рынке по более выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи. В данный момент клиент хочет  закупить 3  бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Odina A. resides in the town of Kulob. 47-years-old, he is married and has five children. He has a stall at the local market where he trades in meat. He buys farm animals locally and feeds them. After fattening, he sells the meat for a profit at the market. His business is the sole source of income for his large family. At present he wishes to purchase three steers and plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three steers

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus A. is 59 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has three children.

Yunus processes and sells dried fruits in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruits. Yunus is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example.

Yunus purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with his wife who is pictured in the photo. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means.

All this allows Yunus to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family. Today Yunus is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 9 months. He is going to spend the loan purchasing dried fruits to further process and sell. Yunus expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Increasing the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Batuli's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Batuli is married with three children aged 20,18 and six years old. She own a small shop and she is a tomatoes and onion seller. Every day, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Batuli is looking for a loan to buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities for expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Azmina, Siti, Zainab, Sunna, Raya and Ashura.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Саидова Зульфия жительница города Куляб. Возраст 28 лет, незамужем.Зульфия живет с родителями-пенсионерами.Клиентка занимается пошивом  женского платья.Шьет она на заказ, а так же  занимается пошивом платья для продажи на местных  рынках.Имеет опыт в этом деле болеее 2 лет. На кредит хочет закупить ткань.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya S. resides in the city of Kulob. She is 28 years old and lives with her retired parents. Zulfiya has more than two years experience in sewing women’s clothing. She both sews to order and makes dresses to sell at the local markets. Zulfiya wishes to purchase fabric with her loan and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka Jovičić was born in 1966. She is divorced and she has one child. She is employed in a bakery and she earns there 350 KM monthly. Milka works, also, on agriculture and from this she earns 200 KM in a month.

Milka wants to make better life for her child, so she decided to take a loan with Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM ($US450). She will use this loan to buy food for poultry and pigs. After a few months she will sell some of the poultry and a pig and she hopes to earn in this way. Her wish is to makes her little business with poultry and pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for poultry and pigs.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
G. Rukhsora is 42 years old. She is an optimistic married mother of three children with a strong desire to move up in the world.

As her children grew, so did the costs of their education, and the salary her husband made was insufficient to cover it all, so he decided to leave for Russia to earn more.

For five years Rukhsora has had a small business drying and remaking apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown allowing Rukhsora to contribute significantly to the household and education of her son.

Today Rukhsora requests 2500 Somoni ($US750) for the term of 12 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling. Rukhsora expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots for processing and selling.

loans.name: Rukia's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
