At 21 years of age, Nelly is the owner of a small furniture making shop. She established this business with her husband who she recently decided to join in marriage. They have dreams of building a home where love and tranquility reign. This young couple also compliment themselves in their work. While her husband dedicates himself to manufacturing the beautiful furniture, Nelly is in charge of receiving orders and distributing the finished products. With the loan that Nelly is requesting, they want to furnish their shop with all the necessary tools. With this in mind, they work diligently putting their best efforts, creativity and service in each of their jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necessary tools for furniture making shop.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme mariée agée de 52 ans.elle fait du petit commerce de tissus, parfums,huile de palme etc depuis quinze ans
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is 52 years old and married. She has kept up a small business selling fabrics, perfumes palm oil etc for fifteen years.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabrics

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Su pequeña, pero surtida tienda de abarrotes es el más importante ingreso económico con el que cuenta Elva y su pequeña niña Nadia de 12 años de edad, desde siempre fue una mujer muy luchadora  que cada día pone lo mejor de sí  para sacar adelante su negocio  y a su querida hija.Ambas, actualmente viven en uno de los barrios más lejanos de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde instalaron su bodega, anteriormente esta localidad carecía de una tienda donde ofrecen gran cantidad y variedad de productos de primera necesidad, pero ahora gracias a la  iniciativa y buena atención, está complaciendo satisfactoriamente a sus clientes, y la demanda de su negocio va en aumento.Elva tiene planeado ampliar su tienda; para continuar con su meta trazada, solicita el presente préstamo.
texts.en:
Her small but well stocked grocery store is the most important economic source of income that Elva and her small 12 year old daughter Nadia count on. Elva has always been a strong-willed woman who every day puts her best forward to make her business successful and take care of her daughter. Together they live in one of the most distant neighborhoods of Juliaca, and this is where they put their store. Previously this location didn't have a store where a large quantity and variety of basic needs products were available, put now thanks to this initiative and good service, Elva is meeting her customer's needs and the demand for her business is growing. Elva has plans to expand her store, to continue with her goal she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve her grocery store

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una muchacha de 18 años de edad, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios, inmediatamente decidió dedicarse a la venta de vajillas de porcelana y variedad de utensilios de cocina, su empeño, alegría e iniciativa la están llevando a tener éxito en su negocio, lo que le permitirá cubrir satisfactoriamente sus estudios superiores. Adquiere  su mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, y  la vende de forma ambulatoria en su ciudad, Juliaca.Por la variedad y novedosas mercaderías que ofrece está logrando  obtener buenos beneficios económicos.Ahora, debido a demanda de sus clientes desea aumentar el monto de su capital, es por esa razón que solicita este préstamo, dinero que  tiene pensado invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a young 18-year-old woman. Ever since she completed her high school studies, she immediately decided to sell porcelain dinnerware and a variety of kitchen utensils for a living. Her dedication, delight, and initiative have caused her to be prosperous in her business, which will allow her to adequately cover her university studies. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima, then sells it as a street vendor in her city, Juliaca. Because of the variety and the innovative products that she offers, she has managed to obtain good profits. Now, due to customer demand, she would like to increase her capital, which is why she is requesting this loan that will be invested in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mary Nambalirwa's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 20 and 5. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a 2-room house, where she is staying with 4 of her husband's children. There are 6 people who live there.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Mary works in Owino market, one of the city suburbs, and deals in second-hand clothes. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and works 6 days a week. Mary's monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She has been in this business for 6 years. She used to operate a beauty salon but had to change to second-hand clothes due to the high demand for them and their profitability.

Mary's main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which makes storage facilities difficult. She has been with MCDT for 6 years and is servicing her eleventh loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business. .

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Khar

texts.fr: Khar F. est une femme mariée agée de 39 ans.elle habite au quartier cite lamy et vend du petit déjeuner depuis dix ans.
texts.en:
Khar F. is a married 39-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district and has been selling breakfasts for 10 years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breakfasts

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia siempre demostró tener gran creatividad y habilidad en sus manos, por ello, desde niña soñó ser una gran cosmetóloga y tener un reconocido salón de belleza, hoy sigue mostrando mucha pasión y diligencia por esta actividad, su clientela se siente muy satisfecha y contenta con su trabajo.Ella es natural del pueblito de Ananea, apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios partió a la ciudad de Juliaca, donde estudió  cosmetología, (nos muestra su certificado en la foto) actualmente va implementando con mucho esfuerzo  su pequeño salón de belleza, ubicado en su pueblo. Su deseo es terminar de implementar su salón, con el  fin de brindar  un mejor servicio a su clientela, es por recurre a este préstamo, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eusebia always demonstrated having great creativity and skill with her hands. Ever since she was a girl she dreamed of being a great cosmetologist and have a renown beauty salon. Today she continues demonstrating a lot of passion and diligence for this profession. Her customers feel very satisfied and content with her work. She was born in Ananea, and just after completing high school she left for the city of Juliaca, where she studied cosmetology (she shows us her certification in the photograph). Today with great effort she is sett up her small beauty salon located in her town. Her wish is to finish setting up her salon, with the goal of providing a better service to her customers, so she is asking for this loan with the promise of being punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue implementing her beauty salon

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: Sus bajos recursos económicos y problemas personales nunca derrotaron Abigail,  joven perseverante de 28 años, desde adolescente buscó innumerables formas de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, así poco a poco independizarse  y apoyar a sus padres en la educación de sus hermanos menores.Luego de tentar suerte con varios negocios, decidió dedicarse íntegramente a la comercialización de prendas usadas, esta actividad le está permitiendo acabar con sus obstáculos económicos, y al mismo tiempo ayudar a sus padres en la educación  y alimentación de sus  hermanos menores.En estos momentos tiene grandes anhelos que la motivan a seguir adelante, pero requiere del préstamo que solicita para  cumplirlos, vender más y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Scarce economic resources and personal problems have never gotten the better of Abigail, a persevering 28-year-old woman. Ever since she was a teenager, she has found innumerable ways to generate her own income, and bit by bit has been able to become independent. She even helps her parents pay for her younger siblings' education. After trying her luck with several different businesses, Abigail decided to fully dedicate herself to selling used clothing, and this activity has helped her overcome economic obstacles and help her parents educate and feed her younger brothers and sisters. Today, Abigail has great dreams that compel her to continue to strive, but she needs the loan she is requesting to fulfill these dreams by selling more and increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es una humilD. y cariñosa madre, desD. muy niña estuvo dedicada a la venta D. pescado dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, oficio que aprendió D. sus padres; gracias a esta labor y al trabajo D. su esposo es que pudieron brindarles educación a sus hijos.Ahora, viendo a sus hijos ya mayores e independientes con sus propias familias se siente realizada como madre, pero al mismo tiempo, sola  y triste por la penosa pérdida D. su compañero D. toda su vida,  su esposo.Actualmente, encontró en su negocio  y sus compañeros D. trabajo la única forma D. distraerse y olvidar los momentos difíciles que le tocó  pasar, por ello, decidió dedicarse íntegramente a su negocio y para ello tiene pensado aumentar el monto D. su capital, para concretar sus planes hace la presente solicitud D. préstamo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a humble and loving mother. Since she was very young she maD. a living selling fish at the Cerro Colorado Market in the city of Juliaca, a traD. she learned from her parents. Thanks to this work and her husband's job, they have been able to proviD. for the children's education. Now, seeing that her kids are grown up and have their own families, she feels like her job has been completed as a mother, but at the same time feels sad and alone after losing her husband, her lifelong partner. Currently she stays busy with her business and her co-workers are her only form of distraction and forget the difficult times that have passed. So she decided to grow her business and for that, she's been planning on raising more capital. She's requesting a loan to help her carry out her plan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for fish-selling business

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Ordenando su mercadería, encontramos a Valeria, de 55 años, madre preocupa, responsable y trabajadora, desde hace 25 años está dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: calcetines,  escarpines, pantalones para niños, caballeros y damas, mercadería que ofrece los días de feria en los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Mientras Valeria se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo trata de sacar adelante su carpintería, entre ambos buscan mejorar su calidad de vida, pero el ingreso que obtienen aun no suple completamente  sus gastos familiares, por ello, Valeria desea aumentar y ampliar su negocio, considera que haciendo estas modificaciones podría obtener mayores beneficios económicos, con ese fin solicita este préstamo, dinero que se compromete en retornarlo en un lapso de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Straightening up her inventory, we find Valeria, a 55-year-old responsible, hard-working and concerned mother. For the last 25 years she's made a living selling clothes such as socks, slippers and pants for all ages and sexes, merchandise she offers on markets days in the distinctive towns surrounding her native city, Juliaca. While Valeria dedicates herself to this endeavor, her husband tries to make headway with his carpentry business. Together they work to improve their quality of life, but the money they make sill doesn't cover household expenses. Valeria wants to grow and expand her business, which would help her increase her earnings. With this goal, she's requesting a loan, which she plans to repay within six months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business and increase inventory

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Alejandro es un muchacho de 24 años, desde adolescente se dedica al trabajo de electricista, labor que aprendió en el colegio técnico industrial en el que estudiaba su nivel secundario, gracias a su iniciativa y perseverancia pudo perfeccionar sus conocimientos, con los que ahora se desenvuelve eficientemente, por lo que sus servicios son muy solicitados en su pueblo, Santa Rosa.Adicionalmente, en sus horas libres se dedica a la compra y venta de carros, esta actividad le está permitiendo mejorar sus ingresos económicos y sobre todo  apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.Su deseo es aumentar el monto de  inversión de su negocio, con ese objetivo solicita el presente préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 24 years old and since adolescence has made a living as an electrician, a trade he learned at a technical school when he was in high school. Thanks to his initiative and perseverance he was able to fine-tune his skills, which have developed to the point that his services are highly requested in his town of Santa Rosa. Additionally, in his free time he dedicates himself to buying and selling cars, which helps increase his finances and, more importantly, helps pay household expenses. He wishes to increase his working capital, which is why he's requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital for business endeavors (electrician and buying and selling cars)

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D. est une femme mariée agée de 58 ans.elle habite au quartier cité lamy.elle s'active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis dix ans.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is a married 58-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district. She has been very active doing commerce in food items for ten years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata W. est une femme veuve agée de 56 ans. elle habite à la cité Senghor et s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Aminata W. is a widow aged 56. She lives in the Senghor development and has been selling cloth for 5 years.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cloth

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una diligente madre de 34 años de edad, junto a su esposo tratan de poner su mayor empeño con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles la educación que se merecen.Hace 13 años radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que viven en esta ciudad, con mucho empeño y dedicación logró implementar su puesto de venta de verduras, en una de las calles más concurridas  de su ciudad.Gracias a su alegría y cálida atención que brinda ha logrado conseguir clientes fieles, actualmente su negocio y la labor de su esposo, como  chofer, les está permitiendo mejorar su calidad de vida.Con el dinero que solicita, Aurora, desea ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
Aurora is a diligent 34 year old mother. Together with her husband they work very hard to give their children a head start in life and provide them the education they deserve. Thirteen years ago they settled in the city of Juliaca. Since living in this city, through hard work and dedication, she managed to open her own produce stand in one of the busiest streets of the city. Thanks to the warmth and attentiveness she offers, she has acquired many loyal customers. Her business and her husband's job as a chauffer has allowed them to improve their quality of life. With this loan request, Aurora hopes to expand her business and increase benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An influx of capital for her produce selling business.

loans.name: Juliet Kanakulya's Group

texts.en:
Juliet K. is 38 years old and divorced with two children, aged twenty and twelve years old. Both of her children are in school. Juliet lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

For the past eight years, Juliet has been selling charcoal. She goes to a village to purchase sacks of charcoal and brings them back to sell in the city; sometimes she even sells the sacks directly from her home. The greatest challenges Juliet faces are customers who don't pay and flooding during the rainy season.

Juliet is requesting a loan to further invest in her business, and she is the leader of a group of four other women who join her in the loan request. Since she began working with MCDT (Micro Credit Development Trust), Juliet has been able to manage her bills and pay the school fees for her children. She hopes to one day be able to purchase a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Ramata N. est une femme veuve née en 1945 à thies.elle s'active dans le commerce d'arachide depuis vingt ans.
texts.en:
Ramata N. is a widow born in 1945 in Thies. She has been active in the peanut trade for 20 years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanuts

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana es una mujer que siempre sobresalió en la bella labor del tejido, al igual que toda su familia está profundamente  ligada a esta actividad,  gracias a sus ágiles manos logra tejer  innumerables y coloridas prendas de vestir, que luego de  reunir una buena cantidad las vende personalmente en el mercado San José  de su  ciudad natal, Juliaca.Con  esta actividad tiene la dicha de brindarles educación y tranquilidad a sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante, el proyecto de Valeria, y para lo que solicita este préstamo, es aumentar el volumen de producción,  está segura que obteniendo mayor cantidad  de materia prima concretará su propósito.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a woman whose work in the beautiful art of weaving always stands out. Like the rest of her family, she has strong ties to this activity. Thanks to her agile hands she has been able to weave innumerable and colorful clothing items, which she later sells personally at the San Jose Market in her native city of Juliaca. This work has allowed her to provide for the education and well-being of her two children, her constant motivators to keep making headway. Valeriana's goal, and the reason why she's requesting a loan, is to increase her production volume, which she can achieve by purchasing more raw materials (fabrics, thread, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire larger quantities of raw materials (fabric, thread) to increase production

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una muchacha muy trabajadora y perseverante de 21 años de edad, a pesar de su condición de mujer, viene incursionando en  el oficio de carpintera, en un principio muchos desconfiaban de su  trabajo y hasta obtuvo malas críticas, pero afortunadamente con su empeño, diligencia y mucha voluntad aprendió rápidamente los trucos  y aplicaciones para un perfecto acabado en las obras de este oficio.En estos momentos, está logrando incrementar sus solicitudes, pero  aun no cuenta con suficientes herramientas  de trabajo, es con ese fin presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hardworking and perserverent 21 year old women. Despite being a woman, she finds herself as a carpenter. In the beginning, a lot didn't trust her work and she received bad criticisms, but fortunately with her work, diligence and much goodwill she quickly learned the tricks and applications for perfectly finishing the works of this trade. These days, she has been able to increase her requests, but they don't come with sufficient work tools, and it's with this end that she's asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring the necessary tools for her work as a carpenter

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción es una madre soltera de 3 hijos,  el amor por ellos, la motiva a esforzarse y perseverar en la vida, desde que formó su familia se  dedicó a la artesanía, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.Adicionalmente a esta labor, hace 3 años abrió su tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ubicada en uno de los barrios más alejados de la ciudad de Juliaca. Gracias a los beneficios que obtienen con sus actividades está logrando brindarles bienestar y educación a sus amados  hijos.Esta pequeña tienda está siendo de mucha satisfacción a sus nuevos vecinos, quienes constantemente le hacen sugerencias para ampliar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos, por ello es que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Concepción is the single mother of three children; her love for them drives her to work hard and persevere in life. Ever since she started her family Concepción has worked as an artisan, a trade she learned from her parents. In addition to her work as an artisan, she has a neighborhood store in her house, located in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Juliaca, which she opened three years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to provide for her beloved children's wellbeing and education. Her new neighbors are very happy with her small store, and are constantly making suggestions for ways to expand her store and new products to offer. She is requesting this loan so that she can fulfill her customers' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her store and variety of merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es una muchachita de 18 años, a su corta edad, es propietaria de un taller de artesanía de tejidos, lugar donde ofrece trabajo a otros dos jóvenes, con quienes hacen un equipo perfecto para el cumplimiento de sus pedidos.Ella adquirió sus conocimientos de su madre, quien con paciencia y dedicación le inculcó este bello  arte.Actualmente  se dedica a la confección de hermosos y coloridos chuchos, chalinas, medias y guantes, que son vendidos al por mayor  en la ciudad capital, Lima. El deseo de esta joven es adquirir materia prima para cumplir con sus  pedidos y seguir prosperando en este noble oficio que la va llenando de satisfacciones.
texts.en:
Ruth is a young 18 year old woman, and at her young age, she is the owner of a workshop for fabric artisanry, where she offers work to to other young people, who make a perfect team for completing their orders. She acquired her knowledge from her mother, who with patience and dedication taught her this beautiful art. Actually she makes beautiful and colorful chuchos, chalinas, medias and gloves, which are sold mostly in the capital city, Lima. The hope of this young woman is to acquire fine material to complete her orders and continue prospering in this noble work which is filling her with satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the material she uses for her work

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene owns a restaurant in the 16 de Noviembre neighborhood in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his wife own their own home in the same neighborhood and have two children, both students, who are 16 and 20 years old and help their parents out in the restaurant. The restaurant offers lunch each day and has many regular customers.

There is a lot of competition with other lunch counters, but Rene's prices are very low, which allows him to maintain a loyal customer base. The restaurant also has very high hygienic standards and the food is high quality, so the business is very stable.

Rene and his wife will use this loan to buy more tables and chairs for their restaurant so that they can seat more clients, as well as new dishes and silverware.

The couple has excellent credit history. This is their fourth loan with AgroCapital, and they have never gotten behind on their payments.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, dishes and silverware for restuarant

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente lives in a rental home with his son and two daughters, who are 15, 10 and 6 years old. Vicente has been working as a contractor for some time now, so he has a great deal of experience. Because he has operated his business for many years now, he is well-known by those who require his services. Further, he is constantly busy and he never lacks work.

Vicente is requesting this loan so that he can buy a station wagon, which costs $4,000. He already has $3,400 in savings, so a $600 loan will cover the difference.

This is Vicente's third loan from AgroCapital. His two previous loans were for $1,000 each. He has always shown himself to be very responsible in making his repayments on time and in full.

loans.use: To purchase a station wagon

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es: El negocio de compra y venta de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca le permite a Pabla, mejorar sus ingresos económicos, como padre y madre de sus hijos, pone su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación a esta labor  que  viene realizando por más de 15 años,  gracias a este esfuerzo pudo brindarles educación y bienestar a sus hijos.Adquiere su mercadería los días de feria de los distintos pueblitos  aledaños de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, luego de reunir una buena cantidad la vende por medio de un intermediario a una empresa textil, el deseo de Pabla es ofertar su mercadería  directamente a una  empresa textil y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos, para ello requiere aumentar el monto de inversión, con ese proyecto en mente presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
The business of buying and selling wool and alpaca fibre allows Pabla to increase her economic income, as father and mother of her children, she gives her best effort and dedication to this activity that she has been performing for more than 15 years, thanks to this effort she has been able to provide education and well-being to her children. She gets her merchandise during holiday days in the different towns around her city, Juliaca. After getting a good amount, she sells it through an agent of a textile company, Pabla’s wish is to offer her merchandise directly to the company and that way increase her income, to do this, she needs to invest more and with that project in mind she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to sell wool directly to a textile company.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa es natural del distrito de Cuyo Cuyo, con el fin de buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en forma ambulatoria, por las diferentes arterias de la ciudad.Pese a sus bajos recursos económicos, viene solventado los gastos de los estudios superiores a sus 2 hijos,  quienes  en sus horas libres la apoyan habidamente en su negocio y le corresponden su esfuerzo, con un buen rendimiento en sus estudios.En estos momentos, Nicolasa, solicita este préstamo para aumentar el volumen de mercadería, está segura que haciendo esta inversión aumentarán sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is from the district of Cuyo Cuyo, with the goal of increasing her quality of life and her childrens’, she decided to move to the city of Juliaca, since then she sells fruits and vegetables in different areas of the city. In spite of her low economic resources, she has been covering the education expenses of her two children, who help her in their free time and make her efforts worthwhile by having good results in school. At this moment, Nicolasa requests this loan to increase the merchandise volume, she is certain that with this investment her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica es natural del departamento de Ica, por situaciones familiares,  hace 27 años radica en el pueblito de Santa Lucia, Puno, desde que formó su hogar, se dedicó a innumerables actividades  para generar ingresos económicos, una de ellas fue la venta de artefactos eléctricos, pero desafortunadamente  sufrió el robo de su mercadería, desde entonces se dedicó a la venta de jugo de frutas, mientras que su esposo Valerio trabaja como obrero en una empresa minera , los dos juntos tratan de salir adelante.Hace un par de meses, Angélica fue operada, por ello que dejó de dedicarse a su negocio, pero ya restablecida, se encuentra deseosa de  continuar con su negocio, para ello necesita el dinero que solicita, su anhelo es seguir ahorrando para poder hacer construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Angelica is a native of the Ica Department. 27 years ago she settled for family reasons in the town of Santa Lucia, Puno. Since she formed her household, she has made her living doing countless activities to generate income. One of these was the sale of electrical devices, but unfortunately her merchandise was stolen. Since then she has made her living selling fruit juice, while her husband Valerio has been working for a mining company, both trying to get ahead. A couple of months ago, Angelica had an operation, so she had to stop her business. Now that she has recovered, she wants to get it going again, which is why she needs the money she is requesting. Her desire is to keep saving up to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to re-start her business, which she had to stop due to health reasons.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja es una joven madre de 26 años de edad, la actividad que aprendió de sus padres le permite cubrir las necesidades  básicas  de su hogar,  sobre todo  la de su pequeña y querida niña Nayel de un añito, su trabajo como artesana textil se convirtió en el sustento principal de su hogar, ya que su esposo tiene trabajos  eventuales  y poco remunerados.Con el dinero que solicita, esta talentosa madre tiene pensado comprar variedad de lana para seguir confeccionando sus pantalones, chullos y  diferentes prendas, que serán vendidas al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.
texts.en:
Maruja is a young mother, 26 years old. The trade that she learned from her parents has allowed her to cover the basic needs of her household, especially the needs of her dear, little girl, Nayel who is one year old. Her work as a textile artisan became the main means of support of her home. Her husband has occasional jobs who are poorly compensated. With the loan that she is applying for, this talented mother will buy a variety of wool to continue making pants, sweaters, and different clothing pieces that will be sold at wholesale at the San Jose market in the city of Juliaca


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of wool and other materials to continue making her pieces.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina es una mujer muy perseverante y emprendedora, sus bajos recursos económicos no le permitieron seguir estudios superiores, por ello, inmediatamente después de concluir la secundaria decidió  dedicarse a la compra y venta de quesos, con este negocio logró  cubrir sus gastos personales y comprar algunos utensilios de cocina,  para así con esfuerzo y voluntad, vender chicharrones (plato a base de carne de cerdo) al paso, en un triciclo que adquirió para transportar lo necesario para su negocio.Gracias a su excelente sazón y a la buena atención que brinda, sus chicharrones son muy solicitados.Ahora, el deseo de Regina es  tener un puesto fijo de venta, con el fin de implementar de la mejor manera su negocio, para una mejora comodidad de ella y sus clientes, por ello solicita este préstamo, dinero que promete rembolsar en un lapso de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Regina is a very perseverant and enterprising woman. Her low economic resources didn't allow her to continue higher studies. That's why immediately after finishing her secondary studies, she decided to start a business buying and selling cheeses. With this business, she was able to cover her personal needs and buy some cooking utensils. With her effort, will and cooking tools, she was able to also sell pork rinds on the go with the help of a tricycle that she acquired to transport what was needed for her business. Thanks to her excellent seasoning and the great customer service that she provides, her pork rinds are in well demand. Now, Regina's wish is to have a fixed selling stall with the goal of improving and increasing her business in order to have more comfort for her and her customers. That is the reason that she is asking for this loan which she promises to pay back in 6 months.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her business and provide more comfort for her and her customers.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta es una mujer muy responsable y emprendedora, desde su adolescencia se dedicó a un sin fin de actividades para generar sus ingresos económicos, actualmente  se dedica a la venta de zapatos para caballeros, damas y niños.Roberta adquiere  al por mayor su mercadería en la ciudad de Tacna y la ofrece en un pequeño puesto de venta que tiene dentro del mercado Tupac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a la buena atención que brinda  y a los  novedosos modelos de calzado que ofrece, logra mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Por el incremento de la demanda, necesita el dinero que solicita para incrementar su mercadearía.
texts.en:
Roberta is a very responsible and enterprising woman. Since her adolescent years, she has dedicated herself to numerous activities to generate an income. Actually, she is dedicated to sell men's, women's and children's shoes. Roberta gets her merchandise at wholesale in the city of Tacna and offers it at a small selling stand inside the Tupac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to the good customer service that she gives and to the original models of shoes that she offers, Roberta has been able to improve her income. Thanks to an increasing demand, she needs the loan that she is asking for to increase her merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of shoes that she sells to satisfy the demand.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer que a pesar de las dificultades viene saliendo adelante, es natural del distrito de Cabanillas, desde que se separó de su esposo, hace más de 6 años, radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, actualmente vive junto a sus 2 menores hijos, en una habitación alquilada.Con el ahorro que disponía decidió comprar un triciclo, golosinas, galletas y bebidas gaseosas, que son vendidas frente al instituto técnico superior de dicha ciudad, hoy se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que va obteniendo, por ello que tiene pensado  aumentar  el volumen y variedad  de productos, por lo que solicita este préstamo, Carmen cree que  haciendo esto mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus  queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a woman who under the weight of difficulties has come soaring up. She is from the District of Cabanillas, where she separated from her spouse 6 years ago. She lives in the city of Juliaca, where she currently lives with her 2 small children in a room that she rents. With the savings that she had, she decided to buy a tricycle, sweets, cookies, and soft drinks, which she sold in front of the Institute of Superior Technology in the city. Today she feels very satisfied of the results that she has obtained, and because of this she is thinking of increasing the volume and variety of her products. This is why she is asking for this loan. Carmen thinks that doing this will increase her economic income, and improve the quality of life of her darling children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the quantity and variety of products that Carmen sells

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es: Ceferina, desde que formó su familia se dedicó a innumerables actividades, con el fin de que sus hijos no pasen limitaciones económicas, hace más de 25 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, con esfuerzo y empeño pudo hacer construir su casa, actualmente tiene una pequeña, pero surtida bodega de abarrotes, adicionalmente a esto se dedica a la elaboración de panes, que son distribuidos en las diferentes tiendas de su localidad.Gracias a su empeño y dedicación está logrando brindarles estudios superiores a sus 3 hijos.Solicita este préstamo que será invertido en la adquisición de harina y otros insumos, para la elaboración de sus deliciosos panes, debido a que  se ha  incrementado enormemente el precio de este insumo, además de mercadería par su bodega.
texts.en:
Ever since she started a family, Ceferina has been engaged in a variety of economic activities with the hope that her children will not be limited by their own economic resources. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for more than 25 years. With a lot of effort and hard work, Ceferina was able to build a house of her own. She currently has a small neighborhood store where she sells a variety of merchandise. Ceferina also bakes bread, which is then distributed to different stores in the area. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she is providing her three children with a college education. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her neighborhood store, as well as flour and other ingredients to make bread with. The price of flour has risen a great deal in recent times.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her neighborhood store and buy flour to make bread with

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Alexander R. is a woman that has four young children – ages 1, 11, 13, and 14 years old. She wakes up in the morning with two things in mind: she thanks God for giving her four reasons to fight each day, and she asks him for energy to do so.

Living in San Pedro de Macoris (where Sammy Sosa was born) in the Dominican Republic, she works steadily to accomplish her dreams of buying a small house that could be comfortable for her family. She walks down the streets doing her best to sell clothes, shoes, and medicine – a person’s daily needs.

In the association of "Cristo La Solucion" there is great belief that our dear God will help all ten members. Mary uses those loans in order to buy more merchandise to sell. Money that she earns helps pay for two things in her life: the necessities that life brings and her children’s and her dreams.

On behalf of the ten women in Mary's group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we would like to thank all of you for supporting these loans. The remaining nine women will be using their loan money to support businesses in used and new clothing sales, small grocery store inventories, food, and agriculture.

loans.use: To invest in her business and purchase more clothes and shoes for re-sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Victoria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Victoria vive en la casa de sus suegros, Victoria anteriormente vendía verduras que compraba en la ciudad de Lima y lo vendía en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Lima, pero cuando nació su hijo tuvo que dejar de trabajar porque se le hizo difícil continuar viajando con su bebe, actualmente Victoria tiene 2 mototaxis, con uno de ellos su esposo realiza transporte público y el otro lo alquila. Además Victoria tiene un pequeña tienda de venta de bebidas, actividad que realiza los fines de semana.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento y la compra del seguro para sus mototaxis.

Victoria sueña con tener casa propia, realizar nuevamente su anterior negocio y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Primavera Communal Bank.

Victoria is married, is 32 years old, and has three children. She lives in the home of her parents-in-law. Earlier, Victoria sold vegetables that she would buy in Lima and sell in the provisions market in Lima. When her son was born, though, she had to stop working because it was difficult for her to continue traveling with her baby. At present, Victoria has 2 motorcycle taxis. With one of them, her husband performs public transportation and the other he rents out. Also, Victoria has a small store where she sells drinks. She works there on the weekends.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the maintenance and the purchase of insurance for her motorcycle taxis.

Victoria dreams of owning her own home, of pursuing again her earlier business, and of her children studying.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the maintenance and the purchase of insurance for her motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía.

Sonia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Sonia vive en la comunidad de Compañía que es un valle que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Sonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación artesanal de ladrillos, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de peones para lo cual utilizan una arcilla especial de la zona, luego son secados al sol y seguidamente quemados en un horno artesanal. Sonia en algunas oportunidades también cosecha tara de terrenos que arrienda.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y tierra. Sonia sueña con adquirir más terrenos para ampliar su producción, construir su casa de material noble y que su hijo puea estudiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañia Community Bank. Sonia is 35 years old and live with her partner and her 4 years old son. She lives in the community of Compañia which is located in a valley one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Sonia and her partner are dedicated to make artisan bricks with the help of some workers. They use a special clay from the area, then the bricks are sun-dried and immediately after they are burned in an artisan oven. In some occasions, Sonia also rents parcels of land for crops

Sonia needs a 1250 soles (Peruvian currency) loan which she will invest in buying wood and soil. Sonia dreams of getting more land to increase her production, build her house out of basic materials and provide her son with an education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sonia needs a 1250 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will invest in buying wood and soil.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía.

Clotilde es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Clotilde vive en la comunidad de Compañía que es un valle que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Clotilde junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación artesanal de ladrillos y también cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos por las mañanas antes de ir a su colegio, los ladrillos en algunas oportunidades lo vende sin ser quemados y también quema en un horno alquilado dependiendo de la demanda de su producto. Además Clotilde viaja a su pueblo de Ocros en donde vende verduras, pescado actividad que realiza una vez por mes.

Clotilde necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra por camiones. Clotilde sueña con construir su casa de material noble, educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales y su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the group bank Los Sauces de Compañia.

Clotilde is 45 years old, married and has four children. She lives in the Compañia community, in a valley located one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Clotilde and her husband are brickmakers, and their children also help them with the work before they go to school in the mornings. Some of the bricks are fired in a rented oven, while others are sold unfired, depending on the demand for each product. Clotilde also travels to the village of Ocros, where she sells fish and vegetables once a month.

Clotilde needs a loan of 2000 soles (about US $700), which she will use to buy truckloads of dirt to make bricks with. She dreams of building her own home out of noble materials, of educating her children up to a professional level (college or technical school), and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dirt to make bricks

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa Group

texts.en:
Yokasta R. is a hard working single mother of a 10 year old child. She is currently living in a small town in San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. She has a small business near the beach, a beauty salon, where women go to get their hair cut, or to get a stylish hair-do.

The beauty salon has been successful for her. She has been able to pay her bills and take care of her child's needs. In the future she would like install her beauty salon in her very own local area. Yocasta works hard even although she is at present fighting an illness.

She is a member of the "Milagros de Cumayasa" with 9 other women. They all get loans to expand their businesses. Yocasta has used the loans to increase her business. It has been very promising for her to receive the loans, which she has used to buy very comfortable chairs for her clients to sit on while she is using her hair dryer, which she also bought, to dry their hair. She has also used her loan in order to buy merchandises like shampoos, conditioners, and other items.

On behalf of all of them, and our team here at "Esperanza", thank you for your support!

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon for her customers.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea T., 38, is married and lives with her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been working as a weaver. She learned how to weave from her mother when she was very young. She also grows vegetables and rice to earn a living and is able to make US$2.5 per day. She says that farming is just to support her family from day to day. She doesn’t earn a profit from farming because the weather conditions are not very good. Most of the provinces do not have irrigation systems. Farmers have to depend on the rain. Inflation is also a problem. Prices of everything, including fertilizer and rice seed, have skyrocketed and most of the farmers cannot afford to purchase fertilizer for their rice fields. Her husband, Vat Ry, 41, is a construction worker who builds house and makes US$3 per day. To double the family's income, Chea is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner of World Relief, so she can breed pigs and cows for sale.

loans.use: To breed pigs and cow for sale.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S., 37, has been employed as garment factory worker since 2005. She makes a profit of US$3 per day. Her husband, Chea Tep, 43, is a rice farmer, but his farm is just to support the family from day to day. He also works as a fisherman and sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 per day. Fishing is not stable. He does not have enough fishing tools and sometime he catches few fish. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed and three other who are students. Yen wants her children to get a bachelor degree rather than work as farmers. Farmers use a lot of labor but make little profit. She is asking a loan from Kiva to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. This will allow her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven M., 43, is a rice farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To earn a living, she is also a rice dealer and is able to make US$4 each day. Her husband is a construction worker and normally makes US$2.5 each day. This couple has four children; two of whom are students and two others who work in construction building houses. Mrs. Ven is requesting a loan from Kiva to add rice stock and raise pigs for extra profit to support the family.

loans.use: To add rice stock and raise pigs for extra profit

loans.name: Sriv

texts.en: Sriv S., 64, works selling Khmer cake to the local people to earn a profit of around US$2.5 per day. The cakes are made from rice, and their cores are bean with sugar palm. In Khmer language these cakes are called "Nom Krouch." This kind of cake is one of the favorite foods among Cambodian people, especially people who live in her village. Her husband, Sut Sat, 70, is a rice farmer and earns US$3 per day. This couple has two children, both of whom are employed. Mrs. Sriv is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her business selling Khmer cake and also to help purchase a water pump to irrigate the crop and rice field.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to irrigate the crop and rice field.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon D., 35, resides with her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows vegetables at her home and takes them to the market to sell.  She earns approximately US$4 each day. Her husband stays at home and helps her growing crops. This couple has two children and one of them is a garment worker. She needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump because the weather conditions are unreliable.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S., 56, is a widowed farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows rice, corn, beans, and peanuts. Normally, she makes US$4 each day. Planting has been difficult, because the weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She needs a water pump and fertilizer to help her plantation. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase the pump and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Liv

texts.en: Liv Y., 52, has a business selling fish and a variety of vegetables in the market since 2001. She is able to make US$3 per day. She is a widow who lives with three children, one of whom is a garment worker and two sons who are farmers growing sugar cane and rice. She would like a loan from Kiva to increase the supply of fish and vegetables that she sells in the market.

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mech

texts.en: Mech N., 39, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has been selling rice in the market to earn approximately US$3 each day. Her husband, Prin Dy, typically makes US$3 as farmer. He grows rice, sugar cane, and beans. This couple has three children, two of whom are students and the other is employed as a garment worker. Planting crops has been difficult, because the weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Mrs. Mech is asking a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizer to help her husband’s plantation.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut S., 44, is a farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows rice, corn, and beans and sells them to the market to earn approximately US$3 each day. Her husband, Ngut Sam Ol, 45, stays at home and helps her planting the vegetables. Plating has been a difficult, because the weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Mrs. Khut would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn P., 51, is a widow living with her two children. She makes various types of baskets and sells them in Siem Reap. She typically makes a profit of US$2 per day. She is also aided by the support of her employed children. One of her children is a waiter in a local restaurant; the other is a customs service officer at the airport. Her son who works in the restaurant would like to begin a new transportation service business. Houn P. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tuk-tuk (a three wheeled motortaxi that transports customers in its carriage) for her son to operate his transportation service. The family believes the income generated from this business will be much better than working at the restaurant and he can transport people to and from the airport for a steady stream of customers.

loans.use: Purchase a tuk tuk for her son

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en: Eoeun P., 51, is a widowed farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1999, she has been growing rice and sugar cane to earn a living and is able to make US$4 each day. She has four children, one of whom is a garment worker and another is a motor-taxi driver. The weather conditions have been bad in the past year, so she needs to loan to purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm. She will use the rest of the money to set up a grocery stand for one of her daughters to operate from her home.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer for her farm and to set up a grocery stand

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Samrith S., 57, is a mother of three children and resides in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1999, she has grown rice and corn to earn a living and is able to make US$2.5 per day. Her husband, Yan Saroeun, 59, is a high school teacher. On average, he makes US$2.7 per day. Two of their children are employed as construction workers building house. Mrs. Samrith is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizer. To own a water pump is very important, because the weather conditions area unreliable.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kheiv

texts.en: Kheiv C., 33, is a farmer who lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows rice, corn, and beans to earn a living and is able to make US$3 per day. Her husband, Ouk Channy, 39, is a policeman and typically makes US$2.5 each day. This couple has two children who are both students. Khiev is asking for a loan to purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry H., born in 1954, resells fish that she purchases from the local fishermen near the docks in Siem Reap where she lives with her husband, Ry Nghit. She typically makes US$4 each day while her husband works in construction and provides US$3 each day to help support their four children. Two of their children are also employed—one in construction and one in the fishing industry. They help to provide additional income for the family. The family's typical daily expenses are $2 for food, $0.35 for utilities, $1 for education, and $1.25 for transportation needs. Ry H. would like to expand her business and increase her customer base so she can increase her income, allowing her to provide more for her family. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$200 to purchase more fish from the fishermen and increase her inventory so that she can sell more to her customers. In the future, Ry H., would like to expand her business through the purchase of a stand in the local market where she could have a more permanent location and reach more customers.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Since 2004 Sok S., 46, a widow living in Kampong Cham, Cambodia has been selling porridge and soup outside of her home to earn a living, making $5 in profits per day. She has three children, one a student and the other two construction workers who build houses, earning a combined salary of $5 each day. 

Sok lists her monthly expenses as follows: food - $75; utilities - $5, motor-taxi - $15; other expenses - $10. She faces competition from several vendors who operate the same business as hers, so in order to satisfy and retain her customers, she is requesting a loan to increase the amount and variety of rice, porridge and soup she can offer.

Through these measures she hopes to earn more profit to support her standard of living,  eventually open a big restaurant, and enable her children to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety of rice, porridge and soup she can offer her customers

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng V., 27, is a rubber dealer who lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been purchasing rubber from the villagers and reselling it to the big dealers, earning about $9 per day in revenue. Her husband, 29, is a construction worker who builds houses, normally making $5 per day. Two of their children are students.

Because soil conditions in Kampong Cham make it a good place to plant rubber trees, a large number of people living there work as farmers growing them. In order to increase family income, Seng is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more rubber. The loan will also help purchase a motorbike for her to use as transportation.

loans.use: To purchase additional rubber for her business and a motorbike to use as transportation.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung V., born in 1961, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and four children. She works with her husband on the family's farm, making $3-$4 each day together. One of their daughters is employed in a local garment factory, while the other three are currently unemployed. 

Soung is requesting a loan of $1100 to combine with her personal savings to purchase a car which will enable one of her children to operate a taxi service and generate some additional income for the family. Inflation is rising rapidly in Cambodia, and farmers are feeling a great deal of the economic strain. Diversifying the family's sources of income can allow this family to improve its living conditions and get out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a car to operate a taxi service

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng H., 30, of Kampong Cham, Cambodia, earns a daily profit of $4 purchasing and reselling recycled items. The family’s income is supplemented by her children, who work selling banana ice cream and by her husband, Heng Rim, 31, who grows rice and also sells banana ice cream in the village. On average, he makes $5 each day. 

The frozen treat is a favorite in the village, and Seng is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and cart for her husband to more efficiently operate the ice cream business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and cart for the ice cream business.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 50, and her husband have been growing rice and yams since 2004, earning about $15 per day in revenue. They live with six children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. While weather conditions last year were bad, this year has seen a marked improvement, with stable rainfall, so Neang is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase fertilizer and hire farm workers to grow yams.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire farm workers to grow yams.

loans.name: Soueng

texts.en:
Soueng S., 29, of Kampong Cham, Cambodia, has a business selling rice and coffee outside of her home, yielding her about $3.50 in profits per day. She is assisted by her husband in this enterprise. The couple has four children, one of whom is a student. 

Soueng is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her business through the purchase of more chairs and tables. Despite the problems posed by the high cost of commodities, she plans to build a bigger stand and increase the amount of rice and coffee offered for sale

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to expand her business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong T., 52, is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has had a business selling groceries from her home to earn a living, and is able to make US$4.50 in profits per day. She is aided by one of her children who also works as a construction worker building houses. She told a loan officer that every month she has to spend around US$65 on food, US$5 on utilities, US$15 on transportation, and US$10 on other expenses. Kong is requesting loan to add to her grocery's inventory to satisfy her customers. (Kong is pictured with her husband outside their home.)

loans.use: To add inventory to her grocery business

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en:
Kouy S., born in 1962, has been raising poultry in her home for the last nine years, earning an income of $5 per day to help support her family. Her husband, Him Choo, has been a policeman for many years and makes $3 each day in his local commune. They have three children, one who is married, one who is still too young to attend the local school, and one who is employed by a casino, earning $130 each month to help the family's income. 

Kouy S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase additional feed for her chickens and other poultry. She intends to spend about $500 on the feed and use the other $300 to purchase a motorbike to be used both for business and personal transportation.

Kouy S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase feed for poultry and a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas N., 34, a pig farmer who lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, typically makes $6.50 in revenue per day while her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns about $4 each day. 

Despite the rapidly rising cost of pig feed and the loss of the occasional pig to disease, Meas is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more feed and more pigs to increase her livestock holdings.

loans.use: To purchase more  pig feed and pigs to add to her livestock.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P., 29,  who is married and resides in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, has been growing sugar cane for a living since 2000, earning about $4 each day. Her husband, Nal Nom, typically makes around $2.50 each day as a construction worker building houses. This couple has three children, one of whom is a student while the others are too young to attend school. 

Sok is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase sugar cane seed to grow for the upcoming season, which is fast approaching.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane seed to grow for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach C., 43, married and living with four of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia has been selling fish at the market since 1990 to earn a living, making about $7.50 in profits each day. Her husband, You Heang, 47, is a motor-taxi driver who typically makes $3 per day. Two of their children work in construction building houses to help support the family and are able to make $5 per day. 

Meach is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish she sells to market and increase the volume of fish sold. The motorbike will help reduce the expense she incurs everyday using a motor-taxi. 

Meach is pictured with her husband in her home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport the fish to market and increase the volume of fish sold

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 37, earns about $4 each day selling vegetables in the market while her husband (shown in the picture), a construction foreman who builds houses, normally makes around $5 per day. This couple has three children, all of them students. 

Mao is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun C., 39, a true entrepreneur who resides in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, has been selling sugar cane juice and grocery products out of her home since 2000, earning about $6 per day on average. Currently, Nun is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of S. A. and lives Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. Kosar baji is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. For the last twenty years, her husband has been a milk seller. Each morning he rises at 4am to collect milk from his cattle; he then sells it in various milk shops in his community to earn a profit. Kosar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children and her husband.

Kosar baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for second loan to buy a buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her husband's milk business

loans.name: Some

texts.en:
Some N., 45, a grocery vendor and mother of four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, earns about $1 in profit each day. Family income is supplemented by her husband’s job as a garment factory worker. 

Some is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase yams in bulk for sale, which will help double the family’s income. 

Some's mother is pictured because Some and her husband were unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase yams in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma baji is the wife of M. Akram and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. Najma baji owns a two room brick house with a large front yard where she keeps her cattle. She has been living in this house for the last five years, and she has one young daughter. For the last twenty years, her husband has been a milk seller. Najma baji is a housewife and helps her husband in getting milk from the buffalos. Presently they have ten buffalos.

Najma baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their family milk business

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of N. A. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a three-room brick house that she has been living in for the last ten years. She has three children. Sugran baji's husband has been a milk seller for twenty one years; he gets milk from his own buffalos and sells it in various milk shops. Presently they have five buffalos at home.

Sugran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 43, is a rice farmer and lives with four of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working on their field to grow rice to earn a living and are able to make US$2 per day. Farming is hard as the weather condition is unreliable. Most of the provinces there do not have irrigation systems yet so it too hard to farm by simply depending on the sky. She needs to set up another business as currently her profit is not enough for her standard of living. She is planning to sell groceries. (Chea is pictured with her daughter)

loans.use: Chea would like to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Syed

texts.en:
Syed baji is a wife of H. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. They own a two-room brick house that they have been living in for the last five years. Syed baji is the mother of five children, none of whom are in school. Her husband is a milk seller and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. He has a good reputation in the community, and most of the community buys their milk from him. Syed baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Syed baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: Khum Y., 57, is married and lives with one of her daughters in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband work growing rice to earn a living and are able to make around US$1 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Khum Y. included. She is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice field in case she has difficulty with the water supply.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is the wife of M. Iqbal and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. They own a two-room brick house that they have been living in for the last 15 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. All of her sons are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Zuhra baji's husband is a milk seller with twenty years of experience in the business.

Zuhra baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 47, is a housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family members. She has six children and all of them are employed with different works, most of them are garment factory workers. Mrs. Chea would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start operating a motor-taxi business. This loan would allow the family to increase their profits.

loans.use: Chea would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani baji is the wife of M. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She lives in a mud house and has five children. Rani baji's husband is a milk seller by profession. Rani baji and her husband get milk from their buffalos and sell it in various milk shops. Presently, they have eight buffalos at their house.

Rani baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business. If they earn a good profit from this loan, Rani baji and her husband wish to improve their standard of living and renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.
